    The paper is well organized ------------------------------------------------------ [2 - I am neutral]
    Considering the issues above, the paper is readable ------------------------------ [3 - I agree]
    
T. Technical innovation and relevance
    The authors cite other relevant publications ------------------------------------- [3 - I agree]
    Authors describe relevance of work to the research field ------------------------- [2 - I am neutral]
    The authors apply sound technical approaches ------------------------------------- [2 - I am neutral]
    New ideas are convincingly and logically described ------------------------------- [2 - I am neutral]
    Results are convincing ----------------------------------------------------------- [2 - I am neutral]
    Considering the issues above, this work should be presented  --------------------- [2 - I am neutral]
    
Comments:
Although obtained results are encouraging, I think the 
drawback of this work comes from presenting a centralized 
solution for a problem that is inherent distributed. So the 
proposed solution provides a single-point-of-failure. 

Besides, authors fail in providing a clear view of how 
related works tackle the same problem. 

Section III, which states the proposed scheme, is too short 
to allow a proper understanding of the adopted solution. 
Since there is space left in the work, authors should 
extend this presentation.

fields.subject: Hak-Hui Choi - Q-learning 모델을 이용한 IoT 기반 주차유도 시스템의 설계 및 구현
fields.content:
심사위원 1
1. 유효성 평가를 위해 비교되고 있는 기존 방식인 EWMA 방식에 대한 약어 및 설명(제안한 방법과의 유사/차이점, 인용자료 등)이 추가될 필요가 있음.
2. 각 참고 문헌을 양식에 맞게 수정 필요.
3. "V. 결론 및 향후 연구" 첫 번째, 두 번째 단락 연결 부분 수정 필요.

심사위원 2
요약문에서 약어 SLA의 원문(원어)을 기술하지 않음. 모든 약어는 요약 및 본문에서 각각 처음 등장할 때 원문을 기술하여야 함.
서론이 두 문단으로 되어 있는데, 본 논문의 연구 결과를 기술한 둘째 문단을 제외하면 비교적 간단하게 서술한 첫 문단이 전부임. 또한 참고문헌 8개를 한 번에 첫 문단 끝에 인용함. 각각의 8개 문헌에 대하여 좀 더 상세하게 인용하여 기술할 필요가 있으며, 아울러 연구 배경과 동기 및 종래 연구의 한계 등 보다 구체적으로 서술할 것을 권장함.  
2절은 기존 시스템의 문제점 분석을 다루는 부분인데, 기존 시스템에 대한 참고문헌 인용이 전혀 없음. 참고문헌을 인용하여 어떤 시스템에서 어떤 문제가 있는지 기술하고 표를 이용하여 기존 시스템들의 특징과 장단점을 비교해 기술하면 좋을 것으로 판단됨.  
기존 기법과의 차별성을 보여주기 위해, 알고리즘 1과 그림 2에 기술한 내용이 기존의 Q-learning 기법에 비해서 무엇이 수정 보완되었는지 보다 상세히 기술할 필요가 있음.

심사위원 3
본 논문은 Q-Learning을 활용한 주차관리시스템 구현에 관한 연구내용입니다. 시스템 구현 방법 및 성능평가를 포함하고 있지만 현재상태로 논문의 게재는 어렵습니다. 일단 논문의 구성 및 각 문장의 표현이 다듬어지지 않았고 전체적인 구성이 미흡합니다. 논문에 대한 수정이 이루어졌다고 보기 어렵습니다. 논문의 내용중 인용논문[1-9]와 같이 전혀 설명이 되지 않은 참고문헌들이 많으며 참고문 양식도 전혀 통일되지 않습니다. 한글 초록 및 영문 초록, 제목도 반드시 수정이 필요합니다. 알고리즘 및 메커니즘 설명에 대한 수정이 요구되며 파라미터 WMuse의 경우 WMuser와 혼동되어 사용되고 있습니다. 식(1)의 경우 AB에서 A와 B의 단위가 서로 다른 것 같은데 의미있는 파라미터인지 확인이 필요하며 표3의 경우에는 삭제해도 문제가 되지 않을 것 같습니다. 전체적으로 논문의 독창성 및 표현에 문제가 있는 것으로 판단됩니다.

fields.subject: Hak-Hui Choi - 수중 센서 네트워크를 위한 채널 특성기반의 협력 통신 기법
fields.content:
심사위원 1
제출된 논문은 수중센서네트워크에서의 전송 성능 개선을 위한 협력통신 기법에 대하여 제시하고 있음.
협력통신기법은 무선 RF통신에서 이미 많은 연구가 진행되어 다양한 성능향상 기법이 제시되고 있는 기법이지만 저자들이 제시하고 있는 수중 음파 통신의 경우 전송 채널의 특성이 무선RF 채널과 비교하여 더 큰 전달 지연과 왜곡 및 잡음 특성이 다르기 때문에 무선 RF통신에서 제시하고 있는 협력통신 알고리즘의 직접적 적용보다는 환경에 적합하도록 변형 또는 조정된 기법으로서 제시되어야 함.
논문에서는 수중 음파통신을 위하여 적용되는 협력통신 기법에 대하여 중계노드의 선택 알고리즘과 수신노드에서의 MRC 기법을 중심으로 제시하고 있으나 수중통신이기 때문에 기존 방식에 비하여 어떤 변형 또는 개선이 있었는지를 기술된 내용만으로 판단하기에 어려움이 있음. 
논문 독자들의 이해도 증진을 위해서는 논문에서 제시하는 새로운 알고리즘이 기존 방식대비 갖는 신규성에 대하여 명료하게 설명될 수 있는 것이 필요할 것으로 보임.
또한 송신노드에서 중계노드를 거쳐 수신노드로 협력기법을 통하여 전송되는 과정이 3홉 이상일 경우도 존재할 것으로 보이는데, 제시하고 있는 알고리즘에서는 3홉 이상의 다중 홉에 대한 처리 과정이 명확히 제시되지 않아 이에 대한 보완이 필요해 보임.
논문에 작성된 용어의 경우 수신노드와 싱크노드가 혼용되어 사용되고 있는 등 용어의 혼란이 있어 보이므로 이에 대한 통일이 필요해 보이며 문장 중간중간 오탈자가 보이고 있어 이에 대한 교정도 필요해 보임.
모의실험 결과에서 성공적인 비트 수신당 에너지 소비 결과에 대한 분석 그래프를 제시하고 있으나 어떤 기준으로 이러한 전력 소비가 계산되는 지에 대한 설명이 본문에 보이지 않아 이에 대한 설명 추가가 필요해 보임.
그림 6의 결과는 충분한 사전 설명 없이 제시되고 있어 해당 결과의 의미가 무엇인지 왜 중요한 결과인지에 대한 추가 설명이 필요해 보임. 

심사위원 2
1. 서론부분이나 별도의 chapter에 관련 연구 및 기술에 대한 literature review를 추가바랍니다.
2. 수식 (8)에서 가우시안 노이즈로 가정을 하였는데, 혹시 non-Gaussian 노이즈에 대해서는 고려해보지 않았는지요? 대부분 가우시안으로 간주를 하지만 수중이나 특수한 환경헤서는 non-Gaussian 시그널이 존재한다고 가정을 하면 보다 더 현실성이 있을 것 같습니다.
3. 수중 음파 환경을 모두 deterministic 변수 또는 환경으로 간주하여 수식을 유도 및 기존의 수식을 이용하였으나 논문의 질적 향상과 실적용 가능성 등을 고려하서 stochastic 변수 또는 환경에 대한 수식을 정의하고 문제를 해결해가는 것이 좋을 것 같습니다.

심사위원 3
2장에서 수중 음파 채널 특성, 제안된 협력 전송 기법을 모두 설명하고 있는데 적절하지 않음
2장에서는 기존에 알려진 수중 음파 채널 특성에 대해 기술하고, 제안된 협력 전송 기법은 새로운 장(3장)에서 기술했으면 함. 특히 제안된 협력 전송 기법 설명 시 기존에 제안된 협력 전송 기법에 대한 추가적인 언급이 필요하고 (필요할 경우 참고문헌 추가), 기존 연구와 본인들이 새롭게 제안한 내용을 명확하게 기술하는 것이 바람직함. 
2.1절 식(1)에서 k값을 1.5로 설정했는데 근거가 명확히 설명되어 있지 않음참고로 통상적인 방법으로 계산하면 다음과 같이 설정되어야 함
- 네트워크 분포가 원통형인 경우 단면적 = 2 pi l(엘) x h (높이) --> k=1
- 네트워크 분포가 구형인 경우 단면적 = 4 pi l(엘)^2 --> k=2
- 네트워크 분포가 정육면체인 경우 단면적 = 6 (2l(엘))^2 --> k=2, 비례 상수 변경되어야 함
즉, 구현 분포와 정육면체 분포를 비교할 때 k=2로 동일해야 하고, 구형과 정육면체의 분포 차이를 고려한 계수가 추가되어야 할 것으로 보임
릴레이 노드를 2개로 고정한 이유. 그림 1에서 중계 노드를 2개로 고정했는데 이에 대한 설명 필요. 예를 들면 성능 및 복잡도를 고려해서 선정했다거나 혹은 구현상의 문제 때문인지 구체적인 설명이 필요함 가능하다면 중계 노드 개수를 변경시키면서 성능 변화를 살펴보는 것이 더 바람직함
 2.2-가-(1) 이웃 노드의 목록 구축 방법 설명에서 ADV 패킷을 이용해서 특정 노드와 싱크 노드 사이의 홉 수를 설정하는 방법에 대해 보다 자세한 설명 필요(혹은 참고문헌 추가)
그림 3에서 설명한 최대 비율 결합 기법 구조가 매우 이상함. 일반적으로 다이버시티 이득을 얻기 위해 최대 비율 결합을 적용하는 경우 수신 신호의 채널을 고려하여 신호를 먼저 결합하고, 이후에 최대 우도 검파(MLD; maximum likelihood detection)를 수행하는데 그림 3에서는 각 수신 신호에 대해 검파를 수행한 후에 바이너리 값을 결합하는 구조를 사용하고 있음. 통상적인 최대 비율 결합 기법을 사용하지 않고 그림 3의 구조를 사용하는 이유에 대한 명확한 설명이 필요함
- 3.2절에서는 수학적 해석 결과가 아닌 모의실험 결과를 설명하고 있으므로 절의 제목을 "수학적 결과와 분석" 에서 "모의실험 결과 및 분석" 정도로 변경하도록 권고함
- 그림 4 ~ 그림 6의 결과를 도출할 때 재전송 패킷을 어떤식으로 처리했는지에 대한 설명이 없음
(재전송을 수행하는 경우 재전송 시도 횟수, 패킷 크기, CRC 고려 여부 등) 그리고 패킷 전송 오류가 에너지 및 response time 계산에 어떤식으로 반영되었는지 설명 필요
- 그림 6에서 x축의 time과 y축의 time에 대한 설명이 없음. 전체적으로 그림 6의 결과에 대한 설명이 불충분함
식(8)과 (9) 사이의 shannon capacity에 대한 설명이 어색함. 식(9)이 무한한 대역폭이 아니라 B Hz의 대역폭을 사용할 때 얻어지는 전송율의 상한값을 나타냄
- 그림 2에 대한 설명에 d(n), d(x)에 대한 설명이 누락되어 있음
- 2.2-나에서 maxima l ratio combining 은 "최대 비율 복합" -> "최대 비율 결합"으로 수정 필요
- 수식을 기술한 후 단락이 바뀌는 경우가 아니라면 indentation이 없어야 함. 예를 들어 식(1)을 기술한 후 "k는 분산 요소로 ..."라는 문장을 이어서 설명할 때 단락이 바뀌지 않으므로 indentation 없어야 함 (논문 전체적으로 수정 필요)

fields.subject: Long - IEEE ETFA 2016
fields.content:
----------------------- REVIEW 1 ---------------------
PAPER: 148
TITLE: Energy-Aware Routing Scheme in Industrial Wireless Sensor Networks for Internet of Things Systems
AUTHORS: Long Bach Nguyen and Dong-Seong Kim


----------- Review -----------
The main contribution of the paper is the evaluation of a cluster-based routing strategy for wireless sensor networks

 Comments:

 Overall, the writing style can be improved to provide more clarity to the text.
 The simulation setup and configuration seem far from realistic. A small scale test bed evaluation and a proper simulation calibration would add credibility to the results.

 Abstract
 - "the current work of deploying IWSNs is not compatible to be applied directly into IoT systems", the statement needs some explanation (why not?)

 sec I
 - "it also contributes to degrading end-to-end delay performance", why would the degradation of end-to-end performance be a good contribution? Do the authors mean improvement rather than degradation?

 sec IV:
 - "all sensing nodes in the cluster send data to relay nodes during their allocated transmission time", I have not seen a description of the time allocation mechanism

 sec VI.a
 -  "To reduce the probability of collisions due to the hidden node problem, all nodes are in the carrier sensing range of each other." One paragraph above it is said that the carrier sensing range is 30m, but now it seems to be set to the entire simulation area.
 If  the simulation ignores on purpose that a real deployment may suffer of hidden nodes, asymmetric links, and dynamic ranges (noise, interferences, and other radio anomalies) then the simulation results are necessarily optimistic and cannot be generalized to a real deployment. I would suggest to conduct real tests, even if at a much lower scale, to calibrate the simulation scenarios. Ideal conditions do not happen in reality and may influence largely the results.

 sec VI.b
 - I believe the simulation time referred in the figures reflects the time the simulation took to finish. However, it would be much more interesting to reflect the simulated time so to provide an the idea of how long a network could live such a routing mechanism.
 - I would expect the number of alive nodes to be decreasing with time, but Fig 11 shows a peak in the number of alive nodes (close to 1000 s). How do the authors explain that? Did some nodes resurrect?

 Typos:
 sec I: "for a large *number* of nodes"
 sec I: "are this paper is given", the sentence needs rephrasing.
 sec II: "so it leads to a significant increase..." -> "so *they* [the protocols] ..."
 sec V: " If a neighbor owns a less transmission distance than...", needs rephrasing.
 sec V: "determining potential the next-hop, ...", maybe meant to be " determining *the* potential * next-hop" ?
 sec V: "inform that which nodes is permitted", maybe meant to be "inform * *of* which nodes *are* permitted..."


----------------------- REVIEW 2 ---------------------
PAPER: 148
TITLE: Energy-Aware Routing Scheme in Industrial Wireless Sensor Networks for Internet of Things Systems
AUTHORS: Long Bach Nguyen and Dong-Seong Kim


----------- Review -----------
* It was not very clear how OPNET was used in the simulations.

* The current version of OPNET is 18 while the authors are still using 16.

* Figure 8 shows that the proposed scheme is NOT the best.

* English has to be revised. Example:line 13 of Introduction: "for a large of nodes"


----------------------- REVIEW 3 ---------------------
PAPER: 148
TITLE: Energy-Aware Routing Scheme in Industrial Wireless Sensor Networks for Internet of Things Systems
AUTHORS: Long Bach Nguyen and Dong-Seong Kim


----------- Review -----------
This is a paper about energy-aware routing for Internet of Things.

The authors fail to give a motivation why this would be applicable to Industrial Wireless Sensor Networks (IWSNs). Several of the assumptions are not realistic for industrial communication:

The assumption of one single factory wireless network consisting of 200 randomly placed nodes is not realistic. For a factory system, the number of wireless nodes in one single network would be much much lower, making the need for clustering not necessary. If 200 wireless nodes really would be required in total in a factory, they would be in many separate networks, each of much smaller size.

The assumption of 200 wireless nodes all being within carrier sense range of each other, yet requiring advanced relaying, is not realistic in a factory setting: in a real factory setting either a star topology would be sufficient because of small distances and few nodes, or if multi-hop is needed it is likely to be so difficult channel conditions that the assumption that CS is detected by every node is wrong.

The assumption that one single factory network will contain 200 battery-powered nodes is not realistic. A real factory network will have wired power to most of its sensors and actuators, so even if wireless communication is preferred, the energy issue will only be important for a small subset of the nodes.

The paper starts out with a motivation about "recent" demands that is supported by 13 to 14 years old self-references. This is neither proper nor very convincing.

On the whole, there are several irrelevant self-references that should be removed before any publication.

To summarize, the authors fail to convince me that their solution is relevant to factory automation, and several of the assumptions are plain wrong from a factory perspective. The suggested solution seems much more suitable for a consumer IoT network than for an industrial sensor network.

fields.subject: Tuan - IEEE ETFA 2016
fields.content:
----------------------- REVIEW 1 ---------------------
PAPER: 161
TITLE: Collaborative Transmission Schemes in Industrial Wireless Sensor Networks
AUTHORS: Trong Tuan Nguyen and Dong-Seong Kim


----------- Review -----------
This is useful paper with a careful and detailed comparative analysis of energy-efficiency and performance parameters of a wireless sensor network. Such papers are always welcome.

The results are shown only by modelling and simulation. This is adequate for a conference paper but the results need to be verified in a practical demonstration. The simulation can only measure what you code into it, but a real practical demonstration will always have additional physical influences that have not been captured by a model. Might this be something to consider for a journal paper, perhaps?

The paper is hard to read because the text is so dense. There are too few paragraph breaks. Some pages have only two or three paragraphs. Please could the authors start a new paragraph when the subject changes to make it easier for speed-readers to navigate the paper. For instance, on page 7 in the ninth line of the second paragraph, you can start a new paragraph when starting to talk about Fig 4(b).


----------------------- REVIEW 2 ---------------------
PAPER: 161
TITLE: Collaborative Transmission Schemes in Industrial Wireless Sensor Networks
AUTHORS: Trong Tuan Nguyen and Dong-Seong Kim


----------- Review -----------
This is a dense article that provides: i) analytical study of collaborative transmission schemes in both line-of-sight and non-line-of-sight environments, and ii) numerical simulation results using Matlab tool.

In summary, 32 equations and 13 graphics are condensed and discussed in just 8 pages. This fact, induced this paper to have very small figures (ex. Figure 4a-c) make it more difficult to read.

In my opinion, the results obtained in Section V (“numerical results”) are very interesting and and they could be discussed in the ETFA'2016.

Some questions that should be pointed or answered in this paper are:
- the simulation model is simple and do not consider:
=> source retransmission
=> overhead in the selection of relay nodes (relay node is assumed fixed)
=> overhead in the transmission of coefficients used in the codification (if any)
=> overhead in any control message (e.g beacon etc)
- Are the "high" transmission power values (such as 25bB) adequate values for WSN with low power radios?


Other suggestions
=============
I suggest reducing the size of Figure 1 and consequently to increase the size of Figure 3 or Figure 4.
Typo error ==> “antennae”
Some acronyms are used before definition (e.g DF, IDF)

fields.subject: DDS Node Discovery Scheme with Dynamic Bloom Filters Rizal - JDPC
fields.content:
Associate Editor:
I have had this manuscript for handling for quite a while.  Over that time I have received one review, along with a long list of declined requests for reviewing, the latter typically indicating a low-quality manuscript. In order to make progress, I have studied the manuscript myself.

My conclusion is to agree with Reviewer 1 and to suggest rejection of the manuscript. The reviewer's main complaint is the lack of novelty in the proposed work, evidenced by a long list of already published, similar works, many of them by the authors themselves. Next to this strong overlap with previous work, the paper clearly lacjs any discussion about the state of previous work, and how the new work improves over it. classically, this would have been the "related work" section.

My conclusion is that the submitted manuscript is not fit for publication in JPDC.
Reviewer #1: The paper presents a light extension of several previous works. The first paper proposing Bloom filters to optimize Data Distribution Service discovery protocol is dated in 2011, later some variants have been proposed. The current paper presents a solution to a possible problem previously presented on a conference. After reading those papers, I personally think that the proposed paper does not represent a novelty to be published in JPDC. I provide some references of very similar works previously published.

fields.subject: Joong-Huyck Cha - 비대칭 다중접속기법 기반의 전술 무선 통신망 설계 및 성능개선
fields.content:
[심사위원 의견]
1. 본 논문은 기존의 전술 통신 무선 통신망의 접속방식을 기존의 CSMA/CA 방식보다 성능이 개선된 TDMA 방식을 사용할 것을 제안하고 성능을 비교하였다. TDMA 방식과 CSMA/CA 방식은 각각 서로의 장단점이 존재하므로 그 둘의 비교에 있어서는 엄밀한 성능 평가 기준과 비교가 필요하다. 예를 들면, TDMA 방식은 단말마다 전용슬롯을 할당하므로 충돌이 발생하지 않고 망접속 시간이 빠르다. 그러나, 다수의 접속자가 존재하는 경우, 그리고 그 중 일부의 단말만이 통신을 하는 경우 망 사용 효율이 급격히 떨어진다. 그 반면 CSMA/CA 방식은 충돌에 의한 시간 지연과 망사용 공정성 문제가 발생하지만 망 사용 효율은 높은 편이다. 그 둘의 비교는 엄밀히 이루어져야 하는데, 본 논문에서는 지극히 단순한 measure를 사용하고 있으며 비교도 엄밀하지 않고, 단순히 고정된 대수의 단말에서의 단말기 처리량만을 기준으로 비교하고 있다는 근본적인 한계가 있다.
전반적으로 논문으로서의 성능의 분석보다는 시스템 구현 보고서에 가까운 것으로 판단된다.

그 외의 수정사항으로는 

1. 문장이 명확하지 않은 것들과 문법에 맞지 않는 것들이 다수 발견됨. 예를 들면

page 2.
1). 전술무전기를 물리계층으로 구성하여 망에 접속하기 전에 먼저 수신하고 사용
여부를 판단하여 접속하는 방식으로 다중 접속을 쉽게 구현할 수 있다.
-> 전술무전기를 물리계층만으로 구현이 가능한가? 먼저 (무엇을) 수신한다는 얘기인지?
사용여부란 어떤 자원 (망, 주파수등등)의 사용 여부를 판단하는 것인지 불명확함.

page 3.
2). 슬롯을 기반의 백오프 시간이 필요하다. -> 뭔가 단어가 빠진 것 같음. 
3). 이때 슬롯은 한 단말이 전송한 메시지를 다음 슬롯의 시작 전에 감지 할 수 있는 시간으로
정의되고 그 길이는 무전기의 특성에 의존한다.
-> 슬롯이라는 용어를 정의하면서, 다음 슬롯의 시작전에 감지할 수 있는 시간이라고 정의할 용어를 사용함.
page 7.
4). 프레임의 동기가 성능을 저하시킬 수 있기 때문에 -> 프레임 동기가 왜 성능을 저하함? 

2. CSMA/CA 방식과 TDMA방식의 소개가 명확하고 상세하지 못함.

3. 본문에서는 bps를 italic 체로 사용하고 그림에서는 정자체로 사용함. bps를 italic체로 사용할 이유가 없음.

4. 무선 통신 시스템 시뮬레이션 모델에 있어서 각 단말의 채널 상황에 대한 고려도 필요한데 이에 대한 고려가 없음.

5. 성능 평가는 확률적인 방법을 사용하여야 하는데, 실험 결과 분석에 있어서 단순히 50byte/sec 처리량이 증가하였다는 등의 비확률적인 결과만 기술되어 있음. 즉, 다수의 다양한 길이, 다양한 트래픽에 대해서 평균적으로 thoughtput 과 delay가 어떻게 되고, variation은 (분산은) 어떻게 되는지 등에 대한 엄밀한 분석이 필요함.

6. 그림의 폰트와 본문의 폰트를 통일하고 그림의 해상도를 높일 것.

7. 처리량이란 용어가 무엇인지 명확히 정의되지 않아서, throughtput을 얘기하는지, 단말기의 처리속도를 의미하는지 불명확함.

fields.subject: Distributed Control System for Ship Engines Using Dual Fieldbus
fields.content:
Ms. Ref. No.:  CSI-D-16-00121
Title: Distributed Control System for Ship Engines Using Dual Fieldbus
Computer Standards & Interfaces

Reviewers have now commented on your paper. You will see that they are advising that you revise your manuscript. If you are prepared to undertake the work required, I would be pleased to reconsider my decision.  

For your guidance, reviewers' comments are appended below.

If you decide to revise the work, please submit a list of changes or a rebuttal against each point which is being raised when you submit the revised manuscript.

Reviewers' comments:
Reviewer #1: The paper describes a practical implementation of two well-known fieldbus standards: Modbus and CAN. Both standards have been well investigated, so the contribution of this paper is not clear to me. 
1. Why are Modbus and CAN appropriate standards? 
2. The benefits of using wired vs wireless? for monitoring purposes, wireless communications may provide better scalability and flexibility. 
3. Among wired communication standards, why the author did not consider optical communications?
4. All figures are quite small. 
5. The references are inconsistent. 

Reviewer #2: The authors propose a distributed control system combining Modbus and CAN bus for real time monitoring and controlling the condition of a ship engine. The method proposed in this paper consists mainly in describing the system architecture and then implementing it in testbed scenario.


Major Remarks:
The authors did not succeed totally to explain and/or demonstrate the real objective of their work as well if the given testbed is representative. So i do not see clearly what is the contribution of the proposed system in comparing to the traditional DCSes (CAN bus, or Modbus only) applied in practical applications. Although the idea of combining the advantages of the two standard bus technologies is interesting, the comparison between the proposed DCS and traditional DCSes lack of convincing perspectives. The results implemented in the testbed case satisfy the standard of the IACS, however there are many factors needed to be considered if the proposed system can be realized, for example, cost of systems, complication level of system, etc.

Many equations in the paper should be explained in detail for further understandable flow of reading. They must be cited if they are adopted from the literature or they should be defined clearly. It is better if the authors use a table to summarize all the terms/notation used in the articles.
All the figures should be modified for clear reading. The flow charts for the algorithms/block diagrams could be altered to be bigger. Especially, the captured figures (screenshot) must be in good quality of picture.

In addition, some errors of sentences exists in the the papers. For example, in the line 138-139, "two fieldbusesModbus and the CAN busare...". Or the author uses a very long composed words, such as in the line 306, "cooling oil flow detection sensors" (authors can use "sensors for detecting cooling oil flow" for clear reading).

fields.subject: Long - Wireless Communications and Mobile Computing
fields.content:
Referee(s)' Comments to Author:

Reviewing: 1

Comments to the Author
1. The first part of the system model is not clear. In Fig. 2, the angle \phi_{1r} is defined as the angles between N_i^{(n-1)\tao} - N_i^{n\tao} and N_i^{(n-1)\tao} – S. The definition of \phi_{2r} is similar. But the random movement only require one random angle.
2. In the figures, x and y are used to denote the x-axis and y-axis coordinates. In (1), x and y are used to denote the transmitting and receiving signals. It is confused.
3. In (2), N_{sn_i}/2 is defined as the variance of n_{sn_i}. The SNR should be 2P_s|h_{sn_i}|^2/ N_{sn_i}. Besides, why the noise power is related to the transmitter? The noise power at N_i should be independent to the transmitter.
4. The equations (3) and (4) are not clear. In (3), the channel coefficient is divided into two parts: the pathloss and fast fading. But in (4), the pathloss is calculated with the unit of dB. The expressions in (3) and (4) are incompatible.
5. The basic assumption of this paper is difficult to understand. The value of the work cannot be evaluated.


Reviewing: 2

Comments to the Author
This paper proposed a TDMA-based cooperative relaying scheme that considers the dynamic link quality of assistant nodes. It is shown through simulation that significant performance can be achieved compared with schemes without dynamic link quality considered.
The problems of the paper are as follows:
1) Most of the ideas and analysis were already seen in the publication of reference [13]. No new ideas are proposed in the paper.
2) There are too many ideal assumptions in the analysis that make the scheme not practical, e.g., no signaling overhead considered in the computation of the SNR, TDMA based resource allocation for assistant nodes, and no interference considered.
3) For algorithms 2 & 3, please give more explanation why main-assistant and sub-assistant nodes are used. It seems they have the same functions.
4) There are also some not typical symbols used that are confusing to readers, e.g., the u in equation (24) is packet size (TABLE I shows), why use the word epoch, t is number of assistant nodes.
5) Please explain why there are crossover in the curves of figure 12.
6) Actually eCoRSS is not practical and hard to be implemented, not as the conclusion said.

fields.content:
최종판정의견
수정후 재심사로 판정합니다.
심사위원1:
본 논문의 제목은 무선MAC프로토콜에 대한 성능분석이지만 실제 내용은 항공기 무선통신기술의 성능비교입니다.
3장 무선MAC프로토콜 비교분석도 무선통신기술에 대한 비교로 일부분 CSMA/TDMA기술이 언급되어 있을뿐 입니다.(표2참조)
따라서 제목과 내용이 어울리지 않고 논문을 읽는 사람에게 혼선을 줄수 있습니다.
결과부분역시 BER과 SNR 관계를 표시하고 있어 각 통신기술의 물리적인 특성을 비교하고 있습니다.
따라서 MAC프로토콜 비교와 맞지 않는 내용과 결과를 제시하고 있으므로 
많은 부분이 수정되어 게제불가로 판정합니다.
심사위원2:
1. 본 논문은 문장의 구성 및 서술이 적절하지 못하여 연구내용을 파악하기 곤란한 부분이 있습니다. 따라서 보다 간결하고 명확한 서술이 요구됩니다. 
2. 참고문헌 16,17,18번이 인용되지 않았습니다. 확인 바랍니다.
3. 참고문헌에서 저자명 기술시 표기의 통일성이 요구됩니다.
4. 본문의 오타 및 띄어쓰기를 확인 바랍니다.
5. 본 논문에서는 MAC 방식으로 두 가지 기존의 프로토콜을 선정하여 BER 성능을 측정하였습니다. 두 가지 프로토콜을 선정한 구체적이며 객관적인 내용의 추가가 이루어지길 바랍니다. 
6. 본 논문에서는 BER을 성능평가척도로 선정하여 그 성능을 분석하였습니다. 향후 다른 성능평가척도를 선정하여 그에 대한 성능평가가 이루어지기를 추천합니다.
---------- 기타의견 ----------                                      
- 아래의 참고문헌 양식을 참고하여 영문으로 작성하시기 바랍니다.
<<참고문헌 양식 참고>>
1. 작성 방법
(1) 참고문헌은 본문에 인용한 것만을 반드시 영문으로 기재해야 하며, 기재 방법은 아래와 같은 순서대로 하고, 잡지명과 도서명에는 기울임 효과를 준다.
(2) 참고문헌 목록에는 최근 3년간 출판된 한국통신학회 국내논문지 논문이 최소한 3편 이상 인용되어야 한다. (레터논문의 경우 1편)
(3) 논문 제목의 첫 글자의 처음 알파벳은 대문자로 표시 한다.( 참고문헌 작성 예 참고)
2. 참고문헌 작성 예:               
Ex1). 논문지의 경우(저자명, “제목,” 잡지명, 권, 호, 페이지, 월, 연도.)
[1] S. K. Oh and E. B. Goldsmith, “The better manuscript preparation for speedy publication,” J. Commun. Networks (JCN), vol. 13, no. 6, pp. 10-16, Dec. 2011.
Ex2)단행본의 경우(저자명, 도서명, 출판사명, (페이지), 연도.)

Ex3)학술대회 논문집의 경우(저자명, “제목,” 학술대회논문집명, 페이지, 개최도시, 국가, 월, 연도.)

Ex4)사이버 문서의 경우(저자명, 제목(연도), 접속일시(월, 일, 연도), URL.)

fields.subject: Long - [Computers Standards & Interfaces Journal] - 2016
fields.content:
Reviewers' comments:


Reviewer #1: The main contribution of the paper is a heuristic algorithm eCoRSS, which is to determine two sets: main-assistant node set and sub-assistant node set. The objective is to select reliable relaying nodes in order to enhance the throughput, end-to-end delay, and energy efficiency. Comparing to existing studies, this paper took into account SNR. The organization is good, however there are following points that is not clear to me

1. Why did not the authors formulate the problem in the shape of an optimization problem? In my opinion, it will be clearer if the authors formulate the problem as an assistant node selection optimization problem, which is to determine main-assistant and sub-assistant nodes. The performance of heuristic alg., consequently, should be compared to the solution of optimization-based approach.
2. The simulation looks weird. The authors said that 100 nodes are distributed randomly, so the simulation should be run several times with different seeds. But, the results do not look like that. There is no confidential interval. Moreover, the number of hops is quite small. The transmission range is unreal, please give an example/explanation. What is the transmission power?
3. What is the value of Ebit in eq. 26?



Reviewer #2: The paper propose a novel cooperative mechanism used for selecting the overlay nodes in the MWN (eCoRSS). As presented in the paper, the science quality is quite high to analysis and consider the performance of network. The simulation results convinces the proposed algorithms in terms of throughput, E2E delay and energy consumption. However, there are many points needed to demonstrate clearly in the algorithms:

About wireless channel model for WSNs:
The authors should explain why they use the Rayleigh fading channel but other models and which case that network operates practically, the selected channel model is suitable? In fact, a majority of WSNs use the log normal model for considering.

About the definition and selection of assistant nodes:

1- Which node determine the assistant nodes? (relay nodes or source nodes? or by themselves)
2- The assistant nodes play roles of orverlaying or not?
3- In what cases, the assistant nodes perform their roles?

About the simulation results:

In some the figures (Fig. 9 and 10) presented in the paper, the results obtained from the analysis is shown. However, it is not clear how to get that results by analysis. Do that mean to calculate from the equations? It seems that the paper should add one section Analysis to verify the results.

fields.content:

Dear Mr. Alif Pranata:

The 2017 Wireless Days conference Technical Program Committee has completed the review process for the regular technical program.
We regret to inform you that your paper #1570328399 ('Real-Time Water Quality Monitoring with Pub/Sub Architecture on Wireless Sensor Networks') cannot be accepted for publication in the Proceedings of 2017 Wireless Days conference.

The WD Technical Program Committee worked very hard to compile a strong technical program consisting of outstanding papers. We received a large number of high quality papers and, based on a rigorous review process, some good quality papers had to be rejected due to the lack of space.

The reviewers comments are appended below or can be found at http://edas.info/showPaper.php?m=1570328399 using your EDAS login name alifakbar@kumoh.ac.kr. These comments served as part of the basis for the Technical Program Committee's decision, and they may be of use to you in your future submission.

On behalf of the WD'17 Technical Program Committee, we would like to thank you for submitting your work to 2017 Wireless Days conference and encourage you to pursue further your research in this exciting field. 

Regards,
Manuel Ricardo and Rui Campos, General Chairs
Ricardo Morla and José Ruela, Technical Program Chairs

-----
======= Review 1 =======

> *** Comments to the author: Summarize the strengths and weaknesses of the paper. Provide a rationale for your rating, and suggested improvements (if appropriate).

Authors propose a pub/sub based WSN architecture for water quality monitoring. Authors implemented their architecture using Arduino platforms. They concluded that water temperature is inversely proportional to dissolved oxygen and pH value.
Eventhought authors carried out heavy experiments, the results of this work would be more interesting for agronomy community.
There exist many quality monitoring platforms, so it is not clear from this paper what is original except the conclusion that water temperature is inversely proportional to dissolved oxygen and pH value. Also there is no performance evaluation from networking perspective of the proposed architecture.

> *** Familiarity: Rate your familiarity with the topic of the paper.
Working in this area of research (2)

> *** Relevance to the track and timeliness: Rate the importance and timeliness of the topic addressed in the paper within its area of research.
Little (4)

> *** Technical content and scientific rigour: Rate the technical content of the paper, its scientific rigour and novelty.
Marginal work and simple contribution. (4)

> *** Quality of presentation: Rate the paper organization, the clearness of text and figures, the completeness and accuracy of references.
Well written. (2)

> *** Overall evaluation: Please judge whether the paper should be accepted or rejected
Reject (5)

======= Review 2 =======

> *** Comments to the author: Summarize the strengths and weaknesses of the paper. Provide a rationale for your rating, and suggested improvements (if appropriate).

The paper although interesting, is related to a topic that has already been very thoroughly studied and investigated. 
Approaches as MQTT, AMQP, XMPP are being widely used, but are not referenced correctly 
The authors should update the bibliography section and clearly state which actual improvement they provide with respect to the state of the art.

The authors should clearly state which are the objectives of their paper. Are they proposing the "must have" of the best solution for this specific problem or are they simply providing some hints on pros and cons of the different available solutions. Not even the abstract gives any indication about this.

Then, according to the aims of the authors, they should restructure the paper focusing on a more elaborated description of the proposal and of the evaluation, giving the proper details of the approach used. 

Moreover, another point that is very lightly treated but that should require more input is on the issues and cost of implementing this types of solutions

> *** Familiarity: Rate your familiarity with the topic of the paper.
Working in this area of research (2)

> *** Relevance to the track and timeliness: Rate the importance and timeliness of the topic addressed in the paper within its area of research.
Good (2)

> *** Technical content and scientific rigour: Rate the technical content of the paper, its scientific rigour and novelty.
Marginal work and simple contribution. (4)

> *** Quality of presentation: Rate the paper organization, the clearness of text and figures, the completeness and accuracy of references.
Readable, but revision is needed in some parts. (3)

> *** Overall evaluation: Please judge whether the paper should be accepted or rejected
Weak reject (4)

======= Review 3 =======

> *** Comments to the author: Summarize the strengths and weaknesses of the paper. Provide a rationale for your rating, and suggested improvements (if appropriate).

The authors have implemented a water quality monitoring system using a wireless sensor network with the pub/sub architecture. Tests were conducted in an aquarium and confirm the relationship between temperature, dissolved oxygen, and pH level.

The main contribution is the implementation.

The authors should present results related to wireless networking. They state that "Motivated by those problems and challenges, this paper is aimed at determining the quality of water based on the measurements of oxygen, temperature, and pH value of the water.". This is related to chemistry.

The authors state that "This pub/sub architecture combined with wireless communication using ZigBee protocol shows the main uniqueness of this paper.", but the reviewer sees no strong contribution in this. Moreover, the authors state that "Hence, characteristics of wireless sensor networks to remote water quality monitoring needs to be studied based on the type of sensors required to monitor water quality, availability of bandwidth and frequent disconnection, quality of service required (QoS) on data transmission, urgency of transmission, and transmission data types.", but no results about these characteristics are presented.

Circuit diagrams are not presented in a detailed way.

The experiments are very simple. It seems that just one run was executed. The authors must present mean values of several runs of the experiments, including the variance of the results; e.g., confidence intervals, as this may change conclusions.

The paper must be carefully reviewed. There are several odd expressions. There are no units in Figure 8.

Other issues:
- What do you mean by "One of the work reported that by using publisher and subscriber, network communication can be more efficient in case of round-trip latency and bandwidth"?
- Please review some "strong sentences" such as "The system runs on HTTP protocol for this interface, which is complementary to the ZigBee protocol used for communication among relay and gateway nodes as explained in hardware architecture, and in turn make the system works perfectly." and "These checkings were performed more than once and it is revealed that the system can work perfectly.".

> *** Familiarity: Rate your familiarity with the topic of the paper.
Truly expert in this area of research (1)

Reject (5)

We are pleased to inform you that your paper #1570326937 ('Data-Driven Faulty Node Detection Scheme for Wireless Sensor Networks') has been accepted for WD'17. Congratulations!

Please address any issues raised by the reviewers and revise the paper accordingly before submitting the final camera ready version.

The instructions for preparing the camera-ready copy and the copyright form are available at http://www.wireless-days.com under "Submissions > Author Guidelines".

Please be advised that the final acceptance of your paper for publication in the conference proceedings is contingent upon:

1) Your timely submission of the final manuscript (deadline February 15th, 2017) revised in accordance with the reviewers' comments and formatted according to the guidelines posted on the conference website.

2) In order to reduce the likelihood of no shows, manuscripts will be scheduled for oral presentation only if at least one of the authors registers for the conference and pays the full registration fee by February 15th, 2017. Registration for Wireless Days 2017 is available from the conference website.

Sincerely,
Manuel Ricardo and Rui Campos, General Chairs
Ricardo Morla and José Ruela, Technical Program Chairs

----------
======= Review 1 =======

> *** Comments to the author: Summarize the strengths and weaknesses of the paper. Provide a rationale for your rating, and suggested improvements (if appropriate).

This paper considers the problem of faulty node detection in wireless sensor networks. To detect faulty nodes, the authors argue for the use of a Markov chain model. Thus, an a sound analytic modeling is provided and extensive simulations are conducted to demonstrate the efficacy of their approach.

First of all, the paper is very well written. Both grammar and the style of included figures are convincing and the story is easy to follow. I also like to mention that the problem statement and the discussion of related approaches is straightforward and helps the reader to get into the paper.

The topic addressed by the paper is relevant to the WD conference. Moreover, the performance evaluation seems to show better results in terms of faulty node detection and miss-detection rate.

Despite of that, the degree of novelty of the paper is quite limited. Indeed, such topics have been well studied in the literature, over which many key papers are missing from the citation list. More importantly, in the existing results much more generalized optimization formulation exists. Just Google-Scholar search “WSN, fault node detection”, the list of relevant papers will be there.

I would suggest comparing the performance of the proposed design with more recent works. Indeed, the authors quote many papers, but are not able to relate to them, yet they assume that their strategy outperforms others.

It would be much more convincing to add the confidence intervals for the curves. I also think that averaged results of 50 or 100 simulation runs (for e.g.) presented with confidence intervals will improve some conclusions in the paper.

Borderline paper (3)

======= Review 2 =======

> *** Comments to the author: Summarize the strengths and weaknesses of the paper. Provide a rationale for your rating, and suggested improvements (if appropriate).

In this paper, the authors address the reliability of sensors by proposing a Markov Chain Model to formulate the problem.  The authors classify each node in one of the following state: i) Good, ii) Warning and iii) Bad as defined in Section II.B.
Then, they propose two algorithms to examine the state of each node.  The authors validate their proposal with simulation based on Matlab. The simulations results show that the proposal achieves good performance.

Unfortunately, many comments can be formulated for this paper:

1.      The text must be improved and the reading is really difficult. I believe that the authors do not revise the paper before submission.
2.      The confidence interval of the simulation results must be calculated.
3.      The authors should validate their solution by assuming a whole protocol stack with using network simulator such as NS3, OPNET, QualNet, etc. In fact, the numerical validation with Matlab is really poor.

> *** Familiarity: Rate your familiarity with the topic of the paper.

Little (4)

> *** Technical content and scientific rigour: Rate the technical content of the paper, its scientific rigour and novelty.
Marginal work and simple contribution. (4)

> *** Quality of presentation: Rate the paper organization, the clearness of text and figures, the completeness and accuracy of references.
Substantial revision work is needed. (4)

> *** Overall evaluation: Please judge whether the paper should be accepted or rejected
Weak reject (4)

======= Review 3 =======

> *** Comments to the author: Summarize the strengths and weaknesses of the paper. Provide a rationale for your rating, and suggested improvements (if appropriate).

The paper proposes a faulty node detection scheme with a hybrid algorithm using a Markov chain that gives each node three different states (good, warning and bad), the master node can analyze these states
- What is the difference between “warning” and “bad” states?
- The hidden markov model is not used in the paper; please check the keywords
- The authors need to revise the figures and move the legends such that they don’t cover the plotted results (see figure 5 and 6), and revise the other plots
- In the Fig.5, Why the miss-detection rate increases in the "1st scheme in only CRC"?
- The references format needs revision

======= Review 4 =======

- the topic addressed in the paper is timely and relevant
- the proposed scheme is interesting and has relevant applications

Weaknesses:
- the paper could be better written. Some sentences are gramatically wrong and hard to understand.
