    Considering the issues above, this work should be presented  --------------------- [3 - I agree]
    
Comments:
This work proposes a non-image data classification and energy forecasting for smart factories making use of CNN. This topic is relevant for the conference. 
After discussing relevant related work, the authors present the methodology applied, and discuss the results of the experiments executed. This article is well structured and organized, and the figures are clear and well explained. 
Some small points of improvement are listed below:
-	Section I, last paragraph: the authors could remove the words “following Section I is”, and state directly: in Section II we gave background …
-	The added value of proposed approach over existing solutions should be better emphasized.
-	Please consider including in Section V directions for future work.


C. Clarity of presentation:
    English grammar and spelling are proper ------------------------------------------ [2 - I am neutral]
    Mathematical symbols and equations are easy to understand ------------------------ [3 - I agree]
    Figures and tables are well constructed and informative -------------------------- [2 - I am neutral]
    The paper is well organized ------------------------------------------------------ [2 - I am neutral]
    Considering the issues above, the paper is readable ------------------------------ [2 - I am neutral]
    
T. Technical innovation and relevance
    The authors cite other relevant publications ------------------------------------- [3 - I agree]
    Authors describe relevance of work to the research field ------------------------- [2 - I am neutral]
    The authors apply sound technical approaches ------------------------------------- [2 - I am neutral]
    New ideas are convincingly and logically described ------------------------------- [1 - I disagree]
    Results are convincing ----------------------------------------------------------- [1 - I disagree]
    Considering the issues above, this work should be presented  --------------------- [1 - I disagree]
    
Comments:
The paper compares different neural network architecture to 
the problem of energy consumption forecasting. The goal of 
the paper is to show that convolutional neural networks 
(CNNs) outperform long-short term memory networks (LSTMs), 
both in case of mono- and bi-directional versions in terms 
of better (i.e., lower) computation time.

The paper is generally well written, although there are 
several sentences that are convoluted and hard to follow.

The energy forecasting is an important problem nowadays. 
However, given that the main objective of the paper is the assessment of the better performance in terms of 
the computation time of the CNNs, the authors fail to 
sufficiently motivate the importance of a faster 
computation in this specific application. Their claim in 
the introduction is that "it is expected that such machine 
learning scheme should also be able to deliver in real time 
as possible". This expectation is true in the general case: 
given that two algorithms have more or less the same 
accuracy, the faster algorithm is better than the slower. 
However, the authors do not bring enough explanation of 
this requirement in the specific application domain under 
investigation, i.e., energy forecasting. In particular, 
from the results it can be seen that the tested CNNs are 3-
4 times faster than LSTMs. But in all the cases the 
absolute time required for the computation is in the range 
of 4-15 milliseconds. Is this time scale comparable with 
the one of the process under forecasting? What do the 
authors consider as "real-time"? This is not clear from the 
text. If the forecasting takes place, for example, every 1 
minute or even more, the need to have a total processing 
time of 4 ms instead of 15 ms can be considered irrelevant. 
These aspects are not sufficiently elaborated in the paper.

The reference to figure 1 is not clear. When figure 1 is 
referenced in the text, the authors are elaborating on the 
possibility to use a CNN for 1D data forecasting, while 
figure 1 represents the architecture of the pipeline.

The nature of the dataset is not sufficiently described. 
The authors refer to figure 2 and to [11], however, there 
is no explanation of the meaning of the values in figure 2.

In the description of the experimental test, the 
forecasting horizon is not reported. Given the history of 
the time series from time 0 to t, how many time instants in 
the future is subject of forecasting? This is a rather 
important factor in the evaluation of the forecasting 
accuracy.


C. Clarity of presentation:
    English grammar and spelling are proper ------------------------------------------ [2 - I am neutral]
    Mathematical symbols and equations are easy to understand ------------------------ [3 - I agree]
    Figures and tables are well constructed and informative -------------------------- [2 - I am neutral]
    The paper is well organized ------------------------------------------------------ [2 - I am neutral]
    Considering the issues above, the paper is readable ------------------------------ [2 - I am neutral]
    
T. Technical innovation and relevance
    The authors cite other relevant publications ------------------------------------- [1 - I disagree]
    Authors describe relevance of work to the research field ------------------------- [2 - I am neutral]
    The authors apply sound technical approaches ------------------------------------- [3 - I agree]
    New ideas are convincingly and logically described ------------------------------- [2 - I am neutral]
    Results are convincing ----------------------------------------------------------- [2 - I am neutral]
    Considering the issues above, this work should be presented  --------------------- [2 - I am neutral]
    
Comments:
Since there are a lot of papers about the similar topic, the 
authors should compare the proposal with more recent 
techniques to clarify the effectiveness. In addition, more 
practical situations and environments for smart factory 
applications should be considered. Mathematical background of 
the proposal is also required.


Accepted or Rejected?
The manuscript is marked as REJECTED.
The manuscript is not on the list of registered manuscripts.

In this work, a fault diagnosis based on a convolutional neural network (CNN) for 3D printers is proposed. fields.subject: Love Allen Chijioke Ahakonye, Cosmas Ifeanyi Nwakanma, Jae-Min Lee, Dong-Seong Kim, "SCADA Network Vulnerability and Attack Specifics: Reliable and Efficient Detection", IEEE Transactions on Industrial Informatics as a Special Issue (R)
fields.content:
Dear Authors (CC to Associate Editor, Reviewers),

Thank you very much for submitting manuscript No. TII-21-2729: "SCADA Network Vulnerability and Attack Specifics: Reliable and Efficient Detection" to the IEEE Transactions on Industrial Informatics as a SS on Security and Privacy of Federated Learning Solutions for Industrial IoT Applications submission.

The review process of your manuscript referenced above has been completed. Much to my regret, I have to inform you that in the opinion of the reviewers and Associate Editor in charge, the submitted manuscript is not suitable for publication in the IEEE Transactions on Industrial Informatics.

For your reference, these comments of the reviewers are enclosed.

I look forward for your contribution, and hope to work with you again.

With my best wishes for your success,


Sincerely yours,

Dr. Ren Luo
Editor-in-Chief
IEEE Transactions on Industrial Informatics
http://tii.ieee-ies.org/
renluo@ntu.edu.tw

Encl.:
Reviewer: 1

Comments to the Author
The paper mainly deals with a conventional SCADA systems in the context of reliability and vulnerability. Although the authors have claimed 5 contributions in Sec1, none of them seems novel to be included in IEEE TII article. For example, improving CNN does not seem to be enough as a standalone contribution.
The related work section is verbose and not focused. In other words, what are the criteria the authors used to select these works? What are the pros and cons of each compared to the proposed work? All that need discussion in details.
The methodology is poor and the mathematical foundation missing a lot of needed elaboration. The model itself seems very superficial. Results are not convincing.



Reviewer: 2

Comments to the Author
1. The title of article is very confusing which contains three part, not able to understand.
2. Motivation is missing in the Introduction.
3. Related work is too much lengthy without critical discussion about the difference of this work and previous works. Authors can select a few good related works and show the difference using Table based on important QoS parameters.
4. III. METHODOLOGY is the most important section which has been discussed very superficially, just in a page. Please add more details how it has been done?
5. IV. PERFORMANCE EVALUATION needs more details if future readers want to implement?
6. Section III and IV are very weak sections which needs more details.


Reviewer: 3

Comments to the Author
The paper aims to combine CNN and LSTM and shape a model that classifies benign and malicious DoH traffic in critical industrial systems and Supervisory Control and Data Acquisition (SCADA) networks.
The work is not at the level of prestigious venues like IEEE TII and seems not so match to the scope of the SI, which is mainly on security and privacy issues on FL which seems not visible in this paper. Also, The English and structure of the paper is poor and needs to be restructured in several parts (see large and unclear plots, like Fig. 3, which no need to keep several spaces for this!!). Besides, I can see the formulation of the LSTM is rewording from [29] (see section III.1), which seems not a novelty of the paper. Why were these dates selected? how they tuned? 75/25? How it comes? 20% validation of training?? The comparison is not fair, comparing single against hybrid?!! It is obvious the hybrid results after some tuning and cross-correlation would be better. What are the achievements of the paper? All seems hidden and not well explore. Why do we need an abbreviation table as the length of the paper and the content are insurgent enough! The related work is longer than the proposed approach section!! I cannot find any real-time analysis on the SCADA model and how the results are related to them? The only thing is the dataset. How will security work on it? All are the questions that I cannot find the response for them. Thus, the paper needs to fix it and try related at the level venue.


AE Comments:
Associate Editor
Comments to the Author:
Thank you very much for submitting the paper to IEEE TII SI 'Security and Privacy of Federated Learning Solutions for Industrial IoT Applications'. We checked the reviews and the paper. After checking, we realized that out of 3 of the reviewers, TWO of them are unhappy with the paper and issued REJECT and one issued MAJOR considering several technical suggestions. All of the issues are that the work is lacking novelty and clarity of representation. As noted by the reviewers, they are annoying on the integrity and coherency of the paper. In summary, the reviewers' concerns are:
(1) The original paper does not sufficiently care about the structure, and some typos are found that need to be omitted.
(2) The reviewers require serious attention to the used parameters, carefully check the comparisons metrics, well explain their definitions, template and organization.
(3) The paper's technical merit needs to be carefully revisited and address the changes requested which seem to be detailed on various aspects, Privacy/security and SACADA design-oriented aspects
(4) critics on the security and privacy leakage in results and their questions as integration with the proposed model and architecture.

After considering such issues, the AE team decided to REJECT the work. The reviewers have detailed comments. Please check and consider them in your work.

fields.subject: Mareska Pratiwi Maharani, Jae-Min Lee and Dong-Seong Kim, and "Bearing Fault Detection using Autoencoder-LSTM for Smart Factory", MDPI Sensors journal, 2021 (Major Revision)
fields.content:
Manuscript ID: sensors-1304647
Type of manuscript: Communication
Title: Bearing Fault Detection using Autoencoder-LSTM for Smart Factory
Authors: Mareska Pratiwi Maharani, Jae-Min Lee *, Dong-Seong Kim *
Received: 15 July 2021
E-mails: mareskapm@kumoh.ac.kr, ljmpaul@kumoh.ac.kr, dskim@kumoh.ac.kr
Submitted to section: Fault Diagnosis & Sensors,
https://www.mdpi.com/journal/sensors/sections/fault
Recent Advances in Fault Diagnostics, Prognostics, and Intelligent
Condition-Based Maintenance
https://www.mdpi.com/journal/sensors/special_issues/RAFDPICBM

Dear Authors,
It was a pleasure to review your paper. Find below some observations regarding it:


Reviewer 1:

In this research work is presented a condition monitoring and fault diagnosis strategy based on deep autoencoder and long short-term memory for identifying different fault condition in bearings.
 
The addressed topic is a current topic of high interest to the research community, even more if the use of Deep Learning techniques is applied to face critical problems related to the malfunction of rotating systems.
Although the research topic is interesting, the proposed work lacks of novelty and the contribution is not clear. The authors have to clarify what is the solved problems.
The manuscript has to be written in an impersonal way.
The introduction has to be reinforced by including the discussion of previous published works related to the addressed topic.
A theoretical section is missing, in most of the research papers is mandatory to include all the theoretical basis to carry out the proposed method.
Normally, Figures and Tables are first mentioned in the text and then includes.
A more detailed description of the proposed method has to be appended.
The results must be discussed aiming to provide short conclusions.
The number of included references is not sufficient to support the proposal.


Reviewer 2:

This paper proposes an Autoencoder-LSTM method for bearing fault detection, which can distinguish vibration anomalies from sensor readings. The model performance is illustrated with a real NASA bearing vibration dataset. Model comparisons are conducted to demonstrate the better model performance over two classical algorithms. I have several major concerns listed as follows:
1. The motivation is not clear to me. The authors introduced how they used an autoencoder-LSTM method to analyze a real dataset, but did not explain why such a method must be used. Besides, there are only 9 reference papers listed. A more comprehensive literature review needs to be conducted.
2. In the methodology level, it seems that the authors proposed a new Autoencoder-LSTM model. However, this model is only mentioned in Section 3.3 as a very short paragraph. More efforts should be put to clarify the model novelty.
3. In Section 2.1, the authors claimed “A total of 445 and 538 datasets were used for preparation and testing”. Why did the authors choose such a split? There are more advanced methods such as cross-validation with random splitting.
4. In Section 4 on result analyses, more descriptions, in-depth analysis and interpretations should be provided.
5. The paper writing is poor and needs a substantial improvement, e.g.,
（1）Line 37, change “gives”to “give”, also carefully check this sentence.
（2）Line 40, add “is” before “called”;
（3）Line 81, change “hhas” to “has”;
 (4)   Line 140, change “scores is” to “scores are”.


Reviewer 3:

The paper developed LSTM for  fault prediction. The paper has several issues, including not enough reference to existing studies on fault detection, no novel methodology, not not enough experimental results and comparison to state-of-the-art. Moreover, why LSTM was used, is there any other study based on LSTM, how the network was optimised are missing. 


Reviewer 4:

The authors presented a novel approach using the latent vector from the LSTM algorithm to detect the abnormal bearing behaviors in the temporal domain. Overall, the idea itself is interesting but the current version of the presentation is not suitable for publication for the following reasons:
 
First, the physical meaning of the dataset is very vague. I have read so many times but failed to understand that is the data measuring for.
 
Second, the figures are very vague. For example, Figure 4 & 5, what are the meanings for the y_axis?
 
Third, the quality of Figure 8 & 9 are low. Please do not screen shot the figures from Python but try to plot it by yourself!
 
Last, the measurement of fault is unclear at all. Yes, I did saw the threshold was hit under fault status but how about the overall accuracy, sensitivity, specificity? Btw, how to obtain the threshold is not provided in the text at all.


Reviewer 5:

1. You should add a survey on the existing bearing fault detection methods based on a greater number of relatively recent papers in the field. You should mandatory also include in this survey simple, but still effective "classical" techniques frequently cited in the literature and widely used in industry. You can find good surveys on these in the following papers:
Immovilli, et al.: Diagnosis of bearing faults in induction machines by vibration or current signals: a critical comparison.
Frosini, et al.: Induction machine bearing faults detection by means of statistical processing of the stray flux measurement.
2. You should obligatorily emphasize the novelty of the method proposed by you by comparing it with already cited methods.
3. The theoretical background of the method is sufficiently described in the paper, the method can be easily replicated.
4. As you use results (datasets) from the NASA’s Prognostic Data Repository you should mention clearly (providing the URL address) in the reference list the link where these can be accessed. Supplementary, you should prove their permission to use their measured data.
5. You should detail the bearing faults taken into the study and the way these were "modelled" within the testbench.
6. You should also provide the precision of the sensors used in the testbed.
7. In Fig. 2 please correct "thermocoupies" to "thermocouples".
8. 8: The good accuracy should not be 100% and not 1%?
9. Obligatory use only SI measurement units (remove lb).
10. The revolution per minute should be abbreviated as r/min (upon SI standards) and not rpm.
11. Could you detail how this method could be implemented in industrial environment?
12. The conclusion should be not a simple overview of the paper or a reiteration of the given results. It should present the last word on the issues you raised in your paper, summarize your thoughts and conveying the larger implications of your study, demonstrate the importance of your ideas, and introduce possible new or expanded ways of thinking about the research problem in the discussion.

fields.subject: Kim Si-wan,  Jang Min-hui,  Lee Jae-min,  Kim Dong-seong, "Relay UAV Layout Techniques for High Reliability Communication Networks Considering Energy Efficiency", Journal of KICS, Major Revision
fields.content:
>> Reviewer_R12827

- 제안하는 백업 UAV 배치 방식을 전장 환경으로 국한시킨 이유에 대한 설명이 필요함. 현재 많은 UAV 네트워크 관련 연구들이 자율협력형 무인이동체 네트워크 시스템을 대상으로 진행되고 있기 때문에, 제안하는 방식이 전장환경이 아니더라도 활용이 가능할 것으로 판단됨
- 전장 환경으로 국한한 이유가 있다면, 전장환경에 대한 특성 요약 서술과, 제안하는 방식이 왜 전장 환경에 적합한지에 대한 근거 설명이 필요함
- 2장에서 비교 대상으로 서술한, Ref. [6]과 비교하여 전체 UAV 자체 에너지 소모량과의 비교 분석이 필요함
- 백업 UAV의 경우 넓은 면적을 원주비행하기 때문에, 비행 자체적으로도 베터리 소모량이 크기 때문에 실제 운영 가능 시간 등에 대한 실질적 분석이 필요함
- 백업 UAV가 그림 3.의 중앙에서 호버링 비행을 하면서 나머지 중계 UAV들의 생존을 확인하면서, 문제 발생 시 해당 위치로 이동하는 형태의 배치 구조를 가지는 것과 에너지 효율 분석이 필요함. 이유는 백업 UAV과 60km/h의 고속 비행을 하면서 CSMA/CA 프로토콜로 송수신을 하면 이동성에 따른 문제가 발생할 가능성이 있음
- 실제 UAV 관련 연구에서도 CSMA/CA를 사용하기 위해 802.11p 기반 프로토콜 연구가 많이 진행되었으며, 해당 연구에 대한 reference 비교 분석을 통해 제안하는 방식의 우수성을 더욱 강조할 필요가 있음
- 본문 내 에서 Reference 인용 방식에 대한 양식을 통일할 필요가 있음

>> Reviewer_R12975

본 논문은 다중 UAV를 활용한 공중 중계 최적 위치를 선정하는 알고리즘을 제안하였다. 본 연구에서 제시하고자 하는 목적과 알고리즘에 대한 설명은 자세히 표현되어 있으며 전체적으로 논문의 구성이 잘 이루어져 있다.
하지만 아래의 사항들에 대한 보완이 필요해보인다.

1. Multiple UAV 환경에서 CSMA/CA를 고려하는 이유에 대한 설명이 모호하다. CSMA/CA가 아닌 직교/비직교 자원 할당을 통한 scheduling 기법을 고려하지 않는 이유가 충분히 설명되어야 한다.
동일 자원을 사용하는 가정 하에, 간섭 신호를 고려한 SIR 기반의 UAV relay network에 대한 위치 설계는 [R]에 연구되어 있다. 저자들이 주장한 바와 같이 UAV의 에너지 효율성을 고려해야 한다면, CSMA/CA보다는 SIR 기반의 알고리즘이 센싱 에너지 소모나 Collision 등의 측면에서 더 유리해보인다.
[R]을 포함한 이러한 기법들에 비해 CSMA/CA를 고려한 이유에 대한 명확한 설명이 필요하다. 또한 Section II에서 더 많은 최신 관련 연구 동향을 파악하고 제안하는 기법과의 차이점 비교가 필요해 보인다. 연구 [6] 하나만으로는 관련 연구 동향을 파악하기 힘들다.
[R] S. Hosseinalipour, A. Rahmati and H. Dai, "Interference Avoidance Position Planning in Dual-Hop and Multi-Hop UAV Relay Networks," in IEEE Transactions on Wireless Communications, vol. 19, no. 11, pp. 7033-7048, Nov. 2020, doi: 10.1109/TWC.2020.3007766.
2. 논문 전반적으로 가독성이 매우 떨어진다. 특히 영단어의 대소문자에 대한 구분이 없이 사용되었으며, 동일한 영단어의 사용에 있어서도 표현이 다르다. (예를 들어 CSMA/CA가 CSMA/ CA로 표기되거나 Persist- ence Strategy mod, backoff_time과 backoff_ time 등등)
이러한 부분들은 논문의 전반적인 이해를 떨어트리기 때문에, 논문을 전반적으로 검토하여 오탈자 및 영문 단어 사용에 대해 교정하는 것을 권장한다.

Manuscript Number: ICTE-D-21-00194  
Adaptive LRFU Replacement Policy for Named Data Network in Industrial IoT  
Professor Dong-Seong Kim
ICT Express


Dear Dr. Kim,

Thank you for submitting your manuscript to ICT Express.

I have completed my evaluation of your manuscript. The reviewers recommend reconsideration of your manuscript following major revision. I invite you to resubmit your manuscript after addressing the comments below. Please resubmit your revised manuscript by Aug 18, 2021.

When revising your manuscript, please consider all issues mentioned in the reviewers' comments carefully: please outline every change made in response to their comments and provide suitable rebuttals for any comments not addressed. Please note that your revised submission may need to be re-reviewed. 

To submit your revised manuscript, please log in as an author at https://www.editorialmanager.com/icte/, and navigate to the "Submissions Needing Revision" folder.  

ICT Express values your contribution and I look forward to receiving your revised manuscript.

Kind regards,     

Dongkyun Kim
Editor
ICT Express

Editor and Reviewer comments:


Although the problems being addressed are potentially of interest to our readership, your manuscript does not meet the required quality standards to be considered for publication.


Reviewer #1: The overall methodology is to maintain the frequently requested content in the CS by managing the caching policy.
The Introduction section is well written; the authors clearly defined the objectives and contributions of the proposed scheme.
Literature Review has summarized recent research contributions. These contributions are related to the proposed cache update policy.
The authors clearly defined the problem statement by comparing it with the already proposed cache update schemes.
In the Proposed System section, the replacement policy is explained well. The solution formulation and application are explained well.
In the performance evaluation section, the author compares the proposed Adaptive LRFU scheme with traditional LRFU, LRU and FIFO. The results are clearly explained with reference figures.


Reviewer #2: In this manuscript the authors proposed an adaptive least recently frequently used (LRFU) replacement policy for named data network (NDN) in the industrial internet of things (IIoT) environment. However, LRFU is already been proposed. What is the difference between proposed work and already existing work?
There are lot of papers in which the researchers evaluated the LRFU caching policies. Please find the following work:

https://github.com/adiparamartha/LRFU-Replacement-Policy-using-ndnSIM
https://ieeexplore.ieee.org/document/8978218
https://www.atlantis-press.com/proceedings/icacsei-13/7640

Please state the motivation behind this work and how this work is novel. OR the proposed work is just showing the analysis of existing caching policies.





Reviewer #3: The authors propose adaptive least recently frequently used (LRFU) replacement policy for NDN. The authors claim that they propose introduce the LRFU for use with NDN, however, there are already many papers regarding the use of LRFU with NDN. I have following questions:

1. in case of the proposed 'adaptive' LRFU, how the cache distribution adjusts based on the cache size?
2. How is the proposed scheme different then other similar schemes where LRFU has already been integrated with NDN?
3. What is the motivation to use LRFU particularly?

fields.content:

WCL2021-1364
Low-Complexity Convolution Neural Network for Accurate Arrival-of-Angle Estimation in Low SNR
By: Akter, Rubina ; Doan, Van-Sang; Lee, Jae-Min; Kim, Dong-Seong


Dear Prof. Dong-Seong Kim:

The review of the referenced manuscript, WCL2021-1364, is now complete. I regret to inform you that based on the enclosed reviews and my own reading of your manuscript, I am unable to recommend its publication in IEEE Wireless Communications Letters.

The main reasons for this decision are as follows: [Editor should provide his/her own judgement for rejection of this manuscript here]

Please note that unlike full paper transactions journals, a letter submission to IEEE Wireless Communications Letters does not undergo a major revision. A binary decision is made on the submission, either acceptance or rejection, by Editor. However, you are encouraged to revise and resubmit your manuscript.

You may revise and resubmit your manuscript to IEEE Wireless Communications Letters within 60 days. Please ensure that your revision as a new submission is resubmitted in a timely manner as the Editorial Office will not accept a revision after 60 days have elapsed. When you resubmit, please include a cover letter that indicates the new submission is a revision of an earlier manuscript and the reference number of that prior manuscript. Also include as a supporting document a point-by-point response to the comments of the reviewers and the editor. The responses to comments file must be uploaded in PDF format in the same section in your submission as the body of your paper in ScholarOne Manuscripts, and not under the cover letter.  Please also be aware that ALL submissions to IEEE Wireless Communications Letters must complete the copyright process.

If you choose to resubmit your manuscript, you should complete the resubmission through the Manuscript Central. Click on "Manuscripts with Decisions" under My Manuscripts on the left side of your Author Dashboard and then click on "create a resubmission" under the Actions Column next to your manuscript.

Additional comments include:

Due to the criticism comments from all reviewers and my reading this paper carefully, I make a reject decision on this paper. The main reasons are as follows：as the first reviewer concerns，  a comprehensive comparison among the proposed CNN methods and existing ones ML and MUSIC should be made including complexity and performance, and the second reviewer suggest to add and derive CRLB as a performance benchmark .

The reviewers' comments are found at the end of this email.

Thank you for submitting your work to the IEEE Wireless Communications Letters.

Regards,

Prof. feng shu
Editor, IEEE Wireless Communications Letters
shufeng@njust.edu.cn

Reviewer: 1

Comments to the Author
- Why (SNR) after "root mean squared error" in the abstract ? Im assuming you mean RMSE.
- cross-correlation [3] is a bit misleading. It is true that [3] uses cross-correlation, but this is not a method, it is just a preprocessing block used to obtain the cross-correlation matrix between the subarrays data to
construct a data matrix with free noise. This matrix is then used as input to a proposed algorithm. So insted of 'cross-correlation [3]", this reviewer suggests replacing it with "cross-correlated-based methods[3]", since the enumeration
of keypoints preceeding cross-correlation (beamforming, subspace) and after (ML methods) are "methods" not matrices or pre-processors (if that makes sense)
- "Furthermore, the
simulation results demonstrate that ML-based DOA estimation
techniques are more efficient than model-driven DFM in terms
of accuracy and computational complexity." Don't you think you're exaggerating ? Even though maximum likelihood is not found in your simulations, I'm pretty sure that it outperforms all CNNs mentioned.
- You compare classification accuracy with MUSIC but you don't mention computational complexity of MUSIC in Table I. Why ? Is it because MUSIC is way faster ?
- Why a_i(\theta_i) in equation (3) and not simply a(\theta_i) ?
- Equation (1) you mean A(\Theta) and not A(\theta) as per your definition in the preceeding paragraph \Theta = [\theta_1 \ldots \theta_P]
- You use x twice (equation (4) and equation (1)), please pick another notation for digital form.
- Can you please explain what you mean by "At this point, the AOA is biased owing to the correlation of
non-significant components between various NLOS signals"
- If the multipath model in (5) is used in simulations, it is, to the best of my knowledge, impossible that MUSIC works. MUSIC is a subspace method that works when signal components are not coherent (or not totally correlated). This has to be clarified somewhere in simulations.
- Why is ReLU chosen ? It has been mentioned that "is deployed to solve the notorious problem of vanishing gradients with an efficient learning approach for the proposed network". So, how does the problem of "vanishing gradients" related to AoA estimation ?

Reviewer: 2

Comments to the Author
In this paper, the authors have proposed a low-complexity and robustly applied CNN for the AOA estimation. There are several major comments that the reviewer is concerned with:
1) A corresponding CRLB should added in Fig 4 as a benchmark.
2) Compared with the MUSIC method, the root-MUSIC is a better choice to represent the traditional algorithms. Because it is a more common method, which is a search-free algorithm.
3) The contribution of the paper should be summarized by fewer points rather than four short items.
4) The authors have lost some crucial and important references related to the DOA estimation and machine learning. [1] is the well-known paper about the machine-learning-based DOA estimation. The DOA estimation for the HAD was investigated in [2]. Therefore, they are very related to this work and should be mentioned in this work.
[1] H. Huang, J. Yang, H. Huang, Y. Song and G. Gui, "Deep Learning for Super-Resolution Channel Estimation and DOA Estimation Based Massive MIMO System," in IEEE Transactions on Vehicular Technology, vol. 67, no. 9, pp. 8549-8560, Sept. 2018, doi: 10.1109/TVT.2018.2851783.
[2] F. Shu et al., "Low-Complexity and High-Resolution DOA Estimation for Hybrid Analog and Digital Massive MIMO Receive Array," in IEEE Transactions on Communications, vol. 66, no. 6, pp. 2487-2501, June 2018, doi: 10.1109/TCOMM.2018.2805803.

24-Aug-2021

- The paper claims contribution in components of a DRT system, but the bulk of the paper is spent describing somewhat generic information not specific to these contributions. The paper needs to focus on its contribution and its significance.
- motivation and contribution setup is given in the page 3, but
- connection between the two contributions is not clear, they seem like two disjoint contributions.
- connection between the contributions and the literature review (e.g. Sec.IIA)
- there is not enough space allocated to the first contribution: the implementation of the first contribution is covered in a few paragraphs on page 7, and there is no elaboration of scheduling constraints.
- These contributions should be elaborated on and developed.

- Simulation results:
- Longer time: This type of system should be tested over longer than 6 hours in order to capture full day behavior (e.g. going to and coming back from work). For example, you could test over 24 hours or over a week.
- More vehicles: Even for a small service area, 10 vehicles seems too small. Is this the size of the actual fleet? If not, can you use a bigger fleet?
- Presentation of results:
- For figures 13-16, 18 using a vehicle index for the x-axis is not super useful, because we don't care about the individual vehicle performance. For example, you could plot 'demand' on the x-axis by considering different scenarios, and then 'performance' on the y-axis. You could also include the spread of per-vehicle information in this figure as a box-plot.
- For figures 14 and 15, the y-axis should be autoscaled.

- Literature survey: The paper provides background on the public transit problem and solutions. It might be worth contextualizing this problem with taxi dispatch problem with a similar, analaous adaptive solutions from the private industry perspective such as [1].

- Figure quality: Figure 1 and 2 should be remade: technicically, they are deciminating useful (but simplistic) information, and the aesthetics need to be improved to the journal's standard. Perhaps they can be combined. Captions should be more specific, e.g. Figure 6 caption should say what `N' is.

- Writing quality: The paper has many typos, e.g:
- page 6 "donated" -> "denoted"
- page 1 "On the other hand, It" -> "On the other hand, it"
- page 2 "Information of Technology (IoT)" -> "Internet of Things (IoT)"
- page 2 "A number of general ITS architectures, that address various challenges and technological developments, have been proposed." -> "A number of general ITS architectures that address various challenges and technological developments have been proposed."
- page 3 "which also referred to as the forth" -> "which is also referred to as the fourth"

References:
[1] Taxi Dispatch with Real-Time Sensing Data in Metropolitan Areas: A Receding Horizon Control Approach, Miao 2016


Please note that some reviewers may have attached more comments; please log into https://mc.manuscriptcentral.com/t-its to download them.

Editor's comments:
Editor
Comments to the Author:
In view of the received comments so far, the recommendation is to reject this submission. The contributions the paper is claiming are not fully proven by the proposed results and experiments. I see criticism regarding the scale of experiments, limited evaluations, indicating the section of results is to cover additional aspects. The information to provide should be sufficient to fully reproduce results, key parameters, how to generate the scenarios or how to access them, etc. The paper is not including key mathematical formulations and background to allow not just the full understanding of the problem but also the full reproducibility of the results. Instead, various diagrams are presented, giving the impression the information and discussion provided are rather superficial. In some sections, the paper is providing information that appears to be way too generic which deviates the attention to the key message of which challenges the paper will really tackle. Key references are missing, making it difficult to assess the contribution in view of the state of the art for this paper. The reference list is fully covering the current developments in this field. Please note that similar problems are already addressed in the literature, so the explicit enumeration of unique characteristics of the paper makes it easier for reviewers and readers of the paper to know the contribution. Finally, the paper needs detailed proofreading.

In view of the comments received so far, the recommendation is to reject this paper.

This paper was reviewed by two associate editors of IEEE-Tr. ITS, both of them agree to early reject this paper.

fields.content:
Reviewer(s)' Comments to Author:

Reviewer: 1

Recommendation: Reject (updates required before resubmission)

Comments:
This paper focuses on the robust and hybrid accurate continuous-discrete (ACD) cubature-extended Kalman filter (C-EKF) methodology for next-generation
GNSS integrated system. More precisely, time updates to the state and parameter subvectors were accomplished using the third-degree spherical-radial cubature rule. Optimized performance comparisons of the proposed hybrid C-EKF over the existing cubature Kalman filter (CKF) and the extended Kalman filter (EKF) schemes with-respect-to their probabilistic outages, Yaw error-differences and ergodic capacities were demonstrated in situations of inaccurate PPP caused by GNSS distortions. The opinion of this referee is that this paper is not suitable for publication in its present form. The following issues need to be clarified:
1) This paper has a problem of readability. There are too many abbreviations that reader cannot follow. The authors should remove unnecessary abbreviations so as to enhance the readability of the paper.
2) Compared with the existing Kalman filter models, what are the advantages of the C-EKF model proposed in this paper. Besides, what are the main difficulties in constructing the C-EKF model?  
3) What are the main difficulties in deploying the integrated C-EKF into GPS/IMU? Moreover, why the deployment of integrated C-EKF into GPS/IMU can further record system accuracy? Please give a detailed explanation.
4) The motivation of studying the C-EKF model should be discussed more clearly, such as the research background and advantages of such model.
5)The format of pictures in this paper is not unified, and many formulas are not standard, the authors should take these problems into account.

Additional Questions:

2) Is the paper technically sound?: Yes

3) Is the subject matter presented in a comprehensive manner?: Yes

Reviewer: 2

Recommendation: Accept (minor edits)

Comments:
In this paper, the authors develop and deploy a hybrid C-EKF filtering methodology in a GPS/IMU tightly-coupled four dimensional gaming drones to further enhance their ability to cooperate and execute specific operations. To mitigate the inherent precise point-positioning (PPP) complexities, robust and hybrid accurate continuous-discrete (ACD) cubature-extended Kalman filter (C-EKF) methodology for next-generation global navigation satellite system (GNSS) integrated system is corroborated.


There are comments/suggestions for the authors to consider:

- The organization and the presentation of the paper need improvements for better clarity and readability.

- This paper covers abundant of materials, however, some discussion should be provided on the reasons why the specific techniques are employed in this paper. It is suggested that more discussion should be spent describing the innovation of this paper. fields.content:
Dear Dr. Kim,

Thank you for submitting your manuscript to ICT Express. 

I regret to inform you that the reviewers recommend against publishing your manuscript, and I must therefore reject it. My comments, and any reviewer comments, are below.   

For alternative journals that may be more suitable for your manuscript, please refer to our Journal Finder (http://journalfinder.elsevier.com).

We appreciate you submitting your manuscript to ICT Express and thank you for giving us the opportunity to consider your work.  

Kind regards,     

Mohamed Amine Ferrag
Editor
ICT Express

Editor and Reviewer comments:     
Due to the concerns raised by the reviewer #2, i reject the paper.

Reviewer #1: The reworked version can be accepted


Reviewer #2: The authors proposed a framework based on a blockchain and Convolutional Neural Network (CNN) for the identification and tracking of illegal airborne objects in the Internet of Military Things (IoMT) system. Despite the fact that I don't see any novelty in this paper. I have the following major issues:

1) The authors stated that their model: "outperforms other state-of-the-art CNN models." However, related works statements are very short and without solid comparison with existing work. The authors need to add a Table to show how their work is better than previous works. Also, only accuracy is measured to compare its performance, do you think is it sufficient to show the novelty?
2) Another problem is a design flaw in the machine learning task where the authors do not have a validation set, which could lead to overfitting of the machine learning models. Also, even if the validation set is not available, why not using Drop out or Regularization to avoid overfitting?
3) The authors mentioned that they used Blockchain but how using Blockchain is improving performance, is there any side effect in terms of complexity, latency etc? Also, the authors didn't provide in-depth details about the Blockchain infrastructure. What type of blockchain is used? Private or Consortium? What type of consensus is employed?
4) What if the unauthorized airborne object frequently encrypts its signals? Can the CNN model still be able to correctly classify it as a threat?
5) The paper needs an English review, as there are some typos. E.g.:
- Page 2, left row: "search and rescue(SAR) missions" ==> "search and rescue (SAR) missions"
In a nutshell, the work is incomplete and requires several modifications and seems harshly written and cannot go further in ICT Express in this shape.

Part of the results are presented in the form of a matrix (Figure 2, 3 and 4) with a too small font, it should be enlarged to make it easier to read. On the other hand, it would be interesting to have a brief explanation of Table 3 to facilitate its understanding, as well as of the results presented in Figure 5. fields.content: Dear Prof. Kim: I am writing to you in regards to manuscript # Access-2021-35515 entitled "Key Wearable Device Technologies Parameters for Innovative Healthcare Delivery in B5G Network :A Review" which you submitted to IEEE Access. Please note that IEEE Access has a binary peer review process. Therefore, in order to uphold quality to IEEE standards, an article is rejected even if it requires minor edits. Your manuscript has not been recommended for publication in IEEE Access in its current form; however, we do encourage you to address the concerns and criticisms of the reviewers detailed at the bottom of this letter and resubmit your article once you have updated it accordingly. Please revise your manuscript based on reviewers’ feedback and resubmit; elaborate on your points and clarify with references, examples, data, etc. If you do not agree with the reviewers’ views, then include your arguments in the updated manuscript. Also, note that if a reviewer suggested references, you should only add ones that will make your article better and more complete. Recommending references to specific publications is not appropriate for reviewers and you should report excessive cases to ieeeaccessEIC@ieee.org. We highly recommend that you review the grammar one more time before resubmitting. IEEE offers a 3rd party service for language polishing, which you may utilize for a fee: https://www.aje.com/c/ieee (use the URL to claim a 10% discount). Please be advised that authors are only permitted to resubmit their article ONCE. If the updated manuscript is determined not to have addressed all of the previous reviewers’ concerns, the article may be rejected and no further resubmissions will be allowed. When resubmitting, please submit as a new manuscript via our submission site (https://mc.manuscriptcentral.com/ieee-access) and include the following 3 files: 1) A document containing your response to reviewers from the previous peer review. The “response to reviewers” document (template attached) should have the following regarding each comment: a) Reviewer’s concern, b) your response to the concern, c) your action to remedy the concern. The document should be uploaded with your manuscript files as a “Supplemental File for Review.” 2) Your updated manuscript with all your individual changes highlighted, including grammatical changes (e.g. preferably with the yellow highlight tool within the pdf file). This file should be uploaded with your manuscript files as a “Supplemental File for Review”. 3) A clean copy of the final manuscript (without highlighted changes) should be submitted as the “Formatted (Double Column) Main File – PDF Document Only.” We sincerely hope you will update your manuscript and resubmit soon. Please contact me if you have any questions. For more information on successfully publishing within IEEE Access, please see https://youtu.be/502WPjDhY_0 Thank you for your interest in IEEE Access. Sincerely, Dr. Razi Iqbal Associate Editor, IEEE Access razi.iqbal@ieee.org, razi.iqbal@ieee.org Reviewer(s)' Comments to Author: Reviewer: 1 Recommendation: Reject (updates required before resubmission) Comments: Pros: - This manuscript is easy to follow. - The topic is timely interesting. Cons: - The link between wearable devices and B5G network is weak. The authors mentioned the advantages and disadvantages of the 5G or B5G networks, however, the specific direct or indirect impacts on wearable device usage in this era are not clearly addressed. The entire content still separately reviews the wearable and 5G/B5G parts. Therefore, the overall importance of this review manuscript is limited. - Fig. 2 and Fig. 8 are fuzzy. Please increase the picture resolution. - The authors are encouraged to provide some prospective points. This part can be an individual section. - It might be interesting to discuss some potential scenarios which require wearables to perform real-time high throughput (Gbps) communications, enabling B5G to proactively empower wearables. Additional Questions: 1) Does the paper contribute to the body of knowledge?: Moderate 2) Is the paper technically sound?: This is a review paper. 3) Is the subject matter presented in a comprehensive manner?: Moderate 4) Are the references provided applicable and sufficient?: Moderate 5) Are there references that are not appropriate for the topic being discussed?: No 5a) If yes, then please indicate which references should be removed.: Reviewer: 2 Recommendation: Reject (updates required before resubmission) Comments: 1. Analysis and discussion in Section IV and V are superficial and need further enhancements. It is not clear what exactly authors want to highlight in Section II and III. 2. Figures quality needs improvement. Text in the Figures are not clear. 3. The introduction section in general can be improved by highlighting the contributions and novelty of the work. 4. The reference to covid looks forced in as there is no specific link to this in the paper. 5. There are lot of typos, especially space after commas, semicolon. On page 7 the sentence goes out of margins. 6. What do authors mean by this sentence, "existing wearable device designs need a technological upgrade to meet the objectives of the B5G network"? Should it not be other way round where B5G KPIs have potential to support wearable. 7. Authors claim"COVID-19 crisis has made these market players to continuously undertake strategic initiatives such as new product/ service launch, outsourcing of certain processes and functions, mutual contracts and agreements, and merger and collaborations to sustain market position, maintain global relevance, and maximize profits while meeting the demands of millennial end-users." How? Give reference. 8. Why do authors think that implantable wearable device technologies will result in better management of many chronic diseases like cancer, hypertension, cardiac arrest, diabetes, etc. More details on this would help the manuscript. Additional Questions: 1) Does the paper contribute to the body of knowledge?: It is a review paper. 2) Is the paper technically sound?: Yes 3) Is the subject matter presented in a comprehensive manner?: Partially 4) Are the references provided applicable and sufficient?: Yes 5) Are there references that are not appropriate for the topic being discussed?: No 5a) If yes, then please indicate which references should be removed.: If you have any questions, please contact article administrator: Miss Garima Mongia g.mongia@ieee.org

fields.subject: Esmot Ara Tuli, Mohtasin Golam, Dong-Seong Kim, and Jae-Min Lee, "Comparative Performance Evaluation of Enhanced-OLSR with Topology-based Routing Protocols for UANET", MDPI Drones
fields.content:
Dear Professor Lee,

Thank you again for your manuscript submission:

Manuscript ID: drones-1510388
Type of manuscript: Article
Title: Comparative Performance Evaluation of Enhanced-OLSR with
Topology-based Routing Protocols for UANET
Authors: Esmot Ara Tuli, Mohtasin Golam, Dong-Seong Kim, Jae Min Lee *
Received: 30 November 2021
E-mails: esmot@kumoh.ac.kr, golam248@kumoh.ac.kr, dskim@kumoh.ac.kr,
ljmpaul@kumoh.ac.kr
Submitted to section: Drone Communications,
https://www.mdpi.com/journal/drones/sections/drone_communications
Unmanned Aerial Vehicle-Assisted Cooperative Air and Ground Communications
https://www.mdpi.com/journal/drones/special_issues/UAVCommunication

Your manuscript has been reviewed by experts in the field. Please find your
manuscript with the referee reports at this link:
https://susy.mdpi.com/user/manuscripts/resubmit/ebd463afc45bb4ad27628375299ca767

(I) Please revise your manuscript according to the referees’ comments and
upload the revised file within 5 days.
(II) Please use the version of your manuscript found at the above link for
your revisions.
(III) Any revisions made to the manuscript should be marked up using the
“Track Changes” function if you are using MS Word/LaTeX, such that
changes can be easily viewed by the editors and reviewers.
(IV) Please provide a short cover letter detailing your changes for the
editors’ and referees’ approval.

If one of the referees has suggested that your manuscript should undergo
extensive English revisions, please address this issue during revision. We
propose that you use one of the editing services listed at
https://www.mdpi.com/authors/english or have your manuscript checked by a
native English-speaking colleague.

Please do not hesitate to contact us if you have any questions regarding the
revision of your manuscript or if you need more time. We look forward to
hearing from you soon.

Kind regards,
Mr. Andrew Chen
E-Mail: andrew.chen@mdpi.com

Reviewer 1:
A better description of the proposed E-OLSR protocol has been added, incl. the characteristics in OLSR routing table as well as some extra explanations have been given.
For the simulation modeling in OPNET the authors have given a few comments, however there is still a lack of some facts/figures exposing the essence of such modeling. For more visibility fragments and/or configuration parameters as well as a screenshot with logs/results of such modeling would be presented.
As for the UAV scenario the authors have given some additional details covering the system model and particular physical characteristics. However it'd be nice also to see the exact model and manufacturer of the used/modeled UAV.
As for the experimental results my initial comment would remain valid still. It's nice the authors measure several target parameters, but I'd expect to see also any more valuable conclusions about these values, including ones on the applicability for the real cases reasoning these numerical values, anything on the effectiveness, etc.
Concerning UANET vs. MANET some responses clarifying these aspects have been added to the article.
For the Data Drop Rate a due calculation formula has been added.
Needed explanations on the abbreviations have been added to the text.
Figure 2 has been removed.
Figure 4 has been improved.
A few misprints has been corrected.



Reviewer 2:  Are the methods adequately described? Must be improved.

Reviewer 3: The authors correctly addressed all my comments.

Reviewer 4:

I am still insisting that the paper just investigates the performance of OLSR protocol under different protocol parameters, varying them in range allowed by the specification. This is not a new protocol (E-OLSR) that authors put as part of their contribution. Based on this observation I would recommend to amend the abstract, contribution, conclusion and title of the paper to show that OLSR performance can be improved for UANET by optimising the parameters.

The authors added the description of how their proposed protocol differs from OLSR. I have read the references that they have presented in order to prove that tuning of parameters can be considered as a new protocol. The papers did not convince me: the authors of one of the papers [34] used additional energy-based parameter to calculate willingness, unlike the authors of this manuscript that just decided to put willingness of nodes to maximum without any justification or comparative performance evaluation. Another paper [35] is telling about optimization of OLSR for VANET by tuning the parameters of OLSR from RFC 3626 but they did not call this optimization framework as a new protocol.

The paper [14] T. K. Priyambodo et al, ”Performance Optimization of MANET Networks through Routing Protocol Analysis”, Computers, 2021 is a very good example of the paper that uses tuning of the parameters and the authors call it performance optimization.

I agree that some of the OLSR parameters after optimization can outperform the standard ones defined in the RFC 3626 but this is absolutely not a new protocol.

You said correct - In UAVs willingness is crucial, as many nodes do not want to send traffic due to preserving energy – and in the proposed method you set up it to the highest value without considering energy capacity of the nodes.

The contribution of authors should be changed:

- The optimization of configuration parameters of the OLSR protocol to make it suitable for UANET with renewable energy.

- proposed OLSR configurations outperform the standard one

 

Line 320-327: Read again this paragraph, misprints here. The UAVs altitude is considered to keep constant between 200m and 50m. How the constant can be between 200 and 50m? It is variable then

The UAV’s speeds are selected as 40 ms and 224 30 m s, respectively. Respectively to what?

Extended rate PHY (802.11g) is used as the underlying MAC layer with a data  rate of 24 Mbps and 1 Mbps, respectively. Respectively to what? Two experiments? But you have 4 scenarios.

Table 4 with simulation scenarios – I would move this table to methodology section or to the beginning of 4.1 Simulation Setup where you are talking about nodes.

I liked your additional information that were put into the text: methodology, parameters description, Table 4 with scenarios, missing input parameters for simulation (transmission power and buffer size). One very important comment about not considering Energy constraints (assuming that nodes are not battery powered and have no limit of energy) was added as well. I would highlight it in the abstract, intro and conclusion as well.

fields.subject: Fabliha Bushra Islam, Jae-Min Lee and Dong-Seong Kim, "Smart Factory Floor Safety Monitoring using UWB Sensor", IET Science, Measurement & Technology (Major Revision)

09-Jan-2022

Dear Prof. Dong-Seong Kim:

Manuscript ID SMT-2021-10-0102 entitled "Smart Factory Floor Safety Monitoring using UWB Sensor" which you submitted to IET Science, Measurement & Technology, has been reviewed. Some revisions to your manuscript have been recommended. Therefore, I invite you to respond to the comments appended below and revise your manuscript.

Editor-in-Chief Comments to Author:

I would like to thank the author for submitting their work to IET Science, Measurements and Technology.

Two of the reviewers, as well as the Assistant Editor, agree on the fact that the manuscript cannot be considered ready for publication. There are many issues that require the authors' attention in order to improve the quality and clarity of the paper.

Please, revise the manuscript addressing all the reviewers' comments.

Deadlines:
Because we are trying to facilitate timely publication of manuscripts submitted to IET Science, Measurement & Technology,your revised manuscript should be uploaded as soon as possible. If it is not possible for you to submit your revision in a month, we may have to consider your paper as a new submission. If you feel that you will be unable to submit your revision within the time allowed please contact me to discuss the possibility of extending the revision time.

Before submitting your revisions:

1. Prepare a response to the reviewer comments appended below in point-by-point fashion. In order to expedite the processing of the revised manuscript, please be as specific as possible in your response and indicate the page numbers in the manuscript where you have addressed each comment.

2. Prepare a revised manuscript (an editable text file, not a PDF ), highlighting the changes you’ve made. Save this new document on your computer as you will be asked to upload it during the revision submission process. NOTE: Please be sure to keep in mind reviewer comments and incorporate your responses within the manuscript. There may well be areas where you disagree; for example, you may want to write, "A reviewer suggests that... However, I disagree because...". In any case, please try to address all of the concerns that are raised within the manuscript.

3. In addition to your revised manuscript with changes highlighted, please also save a “clean” copy where the changes are not marked.

4. Please include a separate title page with following details :-
* Title of the manuscript
* All the authors' complete names
* Departmental & institutional affiliations of the authors
* Postal & e-mail address of the corresponding author
* Conflict of interest statement
* funding information
* Data availability statement
* Credit contribution statement
Please refer the below link and provide the data availability statement accordingly in the ScholarOne system and in the manuscript.

https://authorservices.wiley.com/author-resources/Journal-Authors/open-access/data-sharing-citation/data-sharing-policy.html#standardtemplates



To submit your revised manuscript:

1. Log in by clicking on the link below

*** PLEASE NOTE: This is a two-step process. After clicking on the link, you will be directed to a webpage to confirm. ***

https://mc.manuscriptcentral.com/theiet-smt?URL_MASK=5c6ca1b230534d1fa7504cf3499e3850

OR

Log into https://mc.manuscriptcentral.com/theiet-smt and click on Author Centre. You will find your manuscript title listed under "Manuscripts with Decisions". Under "Actions," click on "Create a Revision." Your manuscript number has been appended to denote a revision. PLEASE DO NOT SUBMIT YOUR REVISIONS AS A NEW MANUSCRIPT.

2. Follow the on-screen instructions. First you will be asked to provide your “Response to Decision Letter”—this is the response to reviewer comments that you prepared earlier.

3. Click through the next few screens to verify that all previously provided information is correct.

4. File Upload: Delete any files that you will be replacing (this includes your old manuscript). Upload your new revised manuscript file with changes highlighted, a “clean” copy of your revised manuscript file, any replacement figures/tables, or any new files. Once this is complete, the list of files in the “My Files” section should ONLY contain the final versions of everything. REMEMBER: figures/tables should be in jpeg, tiff, or eps format. We hope that you will designate one of the figures in your paper to be considered for our online covers and potential publication on our blog.

5. Author Contribution Indication
The contributions of each author to this work must now be indicated when you submit your revised manuscript. To add Author Contributions using CRediT taxonomy ( http://credit.niso.org/contributor-roles-defined/), simply click the “Provide CRediT Contribution” link for each author in the ‘Authors & Institutions’ step of the submission process. From there, you will be able to check applicable Author/Contributor Roles. You MUST provide this information as part of the revision process. Author Contributions will be published with the accepted article and cannot be edited after article acceptance. Therefore you must ensure the Author Contribution information you provide is accurate prior to final acceptance.

6. Review and submit: please be sure to double-check everything carefully so that your manuscript can be processed as quickly as possible.


Once again, thank you for submitting your manuscript to IET Science, Measurement & Technology and I look forward to receiving your revision.

Sincerely,
Prof. Tony Almeida
Editor in Chief, IET Science, Measurement & Technology
tony@deec.uc.pt

Wiley Editing Services Available to All Authors
Should you be interested, Wiley Editing Services offers expert help with manuscript, language, and format editing, along with other article preparation services. You can learn more about this service option at www.wileyauthors.com/eeo/preparation. You can also check out Wiley’s collection of free article preparation resources for general guidance about writing and preparing your manuscript at www.wileyauthors.com/eeo/prepresources.

Associate Editor Comments to Author:

Associate Editor
Comments to the Author:
The present version of your paper is not acceptable for publication in IET SMT. Please review the text to fully answer the comments and suggestions of the reviewers.


Reviewer(s)' Comments to Author:

Reviewer: 1

Comments to the Author
The authors propose and evaluate a smart factory floor monitoring system using machine learning and deep learning.

The proposal comes timely and the research is well motivated. Solutions are technically solid and results convincing enough

Presentation comes handy and it is easy to read the paper and understand the content

Related work is handled well and the reader is presented with current state-of-the-art and information how this paper advances the field

Reviewer: 2

Comments to the Author
1.The paper does not provide a clear and accurate description of the problem in the introduction section, limiting it to a pair of confused lines. Some methods are mentioned, constituting presumably the state of the art, but without a good contextualization, they have no significance. The introduction section lacks fluidity and readability.
2.The paper also contains a lot of typos that must be revised.
3.Some background and information of UWB Sensor would make the paper more informative.
4.Include & cite recent publications from current year
5.Abstract Section - Authors are suggested to include their best results of the proposed method to give an overall picture and highlights their contribution towards the field of study.
6.Authors are suggested to include more discussion on the results and also include some explanation regarding the justification to support why the proposed method is better in comparison towards other methods.
7.Conclusion Section - Authors are suggested to highlight their exact best results in comparison of other methods to justify the advantages of their proposed method.
8.Highlight the significance of this work and its contribution towards addressing the existing gaps.
9.The study lacks a theoretical framework which is important for the reader to grasp the crust of the research.
10. Explain why the current method was selected for the study, its importance and compare with traditional methods.
11.Quality of figures is so important too. Please provide some high-resolution figures. Some figures have a poor resolution
12.Mathematical analysis of the proposed scheme is very weak.
13. Results and analysis section should be further improved





Reviewer: 3

Comments to the Author
The article is about how we can utilize the UWB sensor technology for the safety monitoring of human workers. The article is described as an essential and exciting research topic, but I have some concerns and suggestions for the authors. I hope my comments will help improve the presented work's quality.

1) I would like to suggest adding an overview of the Operator 4.0 concept. This is a huge research area that includes many technologies of how we can improve human workers' safety and productivity in the industries. Also, please make a paragraph about the new industrial revolution as Industry 5.0 depends on human-centric solutions.

2) The article is about the UWB sensor and its use for moving to monitor. The indoor positioning system or real-time locating system is missing from the introduction. I would like to suggest overviewing this area as a huge research topic, and I believe it is relevant.

3) Figure 1 and Figure 3 are not referred to and not detailed in the article

4) Fig 2 - there is a BLE antenna, but you do not mention it. Please detail the main part of the sensor device. Also, please define the units of the measured data (breathing, moving samples)

5) Section 3 - I would like to suggest changing the title of this section to Dataset and Methodology (or something like this). The dataset is not detailed at all. What was the period? What are the units of the measurements? Do you label this data? Was it a planned experiment or a usual working day? Please consider merging subsections 3.1 and 3.2.

6) The algorithm's description is too general. Please define a nomenclature for your problem and define the algorithms based on that (the breathing/moving measurement points, etc.)

7) x is multiple defined. Please make coherent the equations.

8) The main results are not precise. Please make a better conclusion where you clarify the new achieved result of your work, and a detailed use case is missing.


A minor comment:
- the Occupational Health and Safety defined twice: the second paragraph as OHS and the fourth paragraph as OSH

fields.subject: Ikechi Saviour Igboanusi, Jae-Min Lee, and  Dong-Seong Kim, "AIM: Auto Integrated Mining for PrivateWireless Blockchain Network" (Rejected)
fields.content:
Dear Prof. Kim:

I am writing to you in regards to manuscript # Access-2021-41910 entitled "AIM: Auto Integrated Mining for Private Wireless Blockchain Network" which you submitted to IEEE Access.

In view of the criticisms of the reviewer(s) found at the bottom of this letter, your manuscript has not been recommended for publication in IEEE Access.  Unfortunately, we will not accept resubmissions of this article.

Thank you for considering IEEE Access for the publication of your research.

Sincerely,

Dr. Peng-Yong Kong
Associate Editor, IEEE Access
pengyong.kong@ku.ac.ae

Reviewer(s)' Comments to Author:

Reviewer: 1

Recommendation: Reject (updates required before resubmission)

Comments:
1. It is assumed that the transaction generator and block miner are the same. If this node is a malicious one and generates fake transactions, how will blockchain security be guaranteed?

2. The section. B- proposed model is very hard to follow. Summarizing notations in a table can help readers to follow this section. Furthermore, notations should be introduced when referred for the first time. Besides, equations should be written in order of their appearance in the text.

3. In equation (3), D_{N_1} and D_{N_2} are eliminated, while in equation (4) they are existed.

4. What is the maximum length of each block? If several nodes generate transactions and mine blocks simultaneously, how does the blockchain overcome the forking?  

5. Tables (1) and (2) are repetitive. Table (3) shows the time cost of each transaction, not table (2) as noted in the third line of column two on page 5.

6. If several nodes generate a single transaction and mine their blocks, the energy consumption is much more than when all of these transactions mine in one block. Please study this issue and at least study such a scenario in the simulation results.

7. The performance of the proposed method is very limited to blockchain networks with considered assumptions, and it is not practical in realistic scenarios.

Additional Questions:
1) Does the paper contribute to the body of knowledge?: Yes, it studies the delay and energy consumption of the blockchain mining process, a big challenge of blockchain implementation.

2) Is the paper technically sound?: Somehow, the proposed method is very limited to impractical assumptions, and it is not appropriate for practical implementations.

3) Is the subject matter presented in a comprehensive manner?: No, the proposed method performance should be studied for more realistic scenarios.

4) Are the references provided applicable and sufficient?: Yes.

5) Are there references that are not appropriate for the topic being discussed?: No

5a) If yes, then please indicate which references should be removed.:


Reviewer: 2

Recommendation: Accept (minor edits)

Comments:
This paper presents a series of methods to reduce the overall transaction finality time. First, the authors integrate the mining process with the sending of the transaction to reduce overall transaction time. Second, the production of the empty block is reduced, which saves energy, storage space, network bandwidth, and computational complexity. Then, an Auto Integrated Mining (AIM) algorithm is developed, in which the mining tasks are performed only when there is at least one pending transaction in the network. Finally, the experiment shows that the proposed methods can effectively enhance the performance of the private blockchain network. However, there are still some issues that need to be revised.

1) The introduction lacks logic to express the innovation point of this paper.
2) The authors are suggested to give more descriptions for the proposed AIM algorithm to highlight the novelty and contribution of the proposed work.
3) The authors are suggested adding more simulation results and figures. In addition, the authors are recommended to add the existing solutions compared with the proposed solution.
4) Some results need to be explained. For example, in Fig.4b, why does there exist a big fluctuation in the orange line.
5) In the literature, only 10 articles have been cited. More related works should be included in the introduction.
6) In the results, the authors show that the proposed method can significantly reduce energy consumption. How to verify it in this paper? The relationship between the number of blocks generated by the network and the energy consumption needs to be given in detail.

Additional Questions:
1) Does the paper contribute to the body of knowledge?: yes.

2) Is the paper technically sound?: yes.

3) Is the subject matter presented in a comprehensive manner?: yes.

4) Are the references provided applicable and sufficient?: No

5) Are there references that are not appropriate for the topic being discussed?: No

5a) If yes, then please indicate which references should be removed.:


Reviewer: 3

Recommendation: Reject (do not encourage resubmit)

Comments:
The paper is poorly written with unclear descriptions and problem identification. The paper should explain clearly the problem and present a more focused survey of related works.

The paper seems to be built on inaccurate or incorrect understand of the working of blockchain or more generally distributed ledger technology. The paper needs to be more specific on which distributed ledger or blockchain it has adopted as the basis.

The paper claims that it has proposed a new algorithm that will start mining only when there is at least one pending transaction. Would blockchain or any distributed ledger's consensus algorithm perform verification when there is no transaction?

The paper claims that is has proposed a new method that can combine transaction sending and mining, to save time. It is not clear at all what does this means. What are being combined and how they are combined?

Comments and Suggestions for Authors
I like the design of the study and think it has value, but I was hoping to see much more detail about the dataset used, as well as some of the techniques used for processing the images. After reading the manuscript, I do not have enough information to understand how some of the above-mentioned parts were carried out.
I suggest that the article entitled "DRONET: Multi-Tasking Framework for Real-Time Industrial Facility Aerial Surveillance and Safety" needs to be revised in the following aspects:
- The dataset built to test the method is listed as one of the contributions. This is only mentioned, but the reference (DOI) to access this dataset is not provided.
- As this dataset is not available, it is difficult to judge the robustness of the model. Even if you are getting 99.99% results if the 100 images of class X are practically the same and the other 100 images of class Y are also the same, then it would be logical to get such good results. It would be appropriate to be able to access the dataset to put the values obtained in context.
- There is an important statement that is not sufficiently validated: "DRONET is an enhanced offshoot of YOLOv5 model designed to overcome the problem of detection of tiny distant objects under hash weather condition". The problem is that the scenarios described (Figure 7) do not appear very adverse (there is a typo in the sentence, it says "hash" instead of "harsh") and simply talks about cloudy environments.
- Another worrying aspect is that when describing the hardware architecture, it is stated that YOLO can achieve rates of 140 fps. It does not seem to have been taken into account that these values may be difficult to obtain on a small board, which is what a drone may have on board. Similar works (a possible reference for this work) such as https://doi.org/10.3390/en13215712, which presents "Remote Management Architecture of UAV Fleets for Maintenance, Surveillance, and Security Tasks in Solar Power Plants" show that it is difficult to obtain these values in flight, around 3-10 fps for equivalent models.
- In reference to the above and given that the authors intend their model to work in "multi-tasking", this type of equipment would perform even worse.
- The authors' contributions should be described in detail, indicating who has been responsible for each part of the work. Equivalent author contributions are neither common nor correct in this type of work or in the area of knowledge.

Comments and Suggestions for Authors
This paper proposed a multi-tasking multi-drone detection, attached object identification, and safe-channel neutralization model to bridge the gap in the existing anti-drone system designs to its harmful status based on the airborne object. The proposed model is validated and the simulation results is thoroughly discussed. The results discussion is clear and insightful. The idea presented in the paper represents a sizeable effort and the paper is well written. 
The following are the suggestions of the reviewer.
1.	As the author mentioned, the current model has several limitations. Future work that might improve the model in these areas could be elaborated.
2.	About the dataset, the author mentioned that 5460 drone samples were manually captured at different altitudes (30m-100m) and scenarios (cloudy, sunny, and evening) and under different environments. How long does it take to generate these samples? Is it possible to use a smaller size dataset?

Dear Prof. Kim:

I am writing to you in regard to manuscript # Access-2022-03435 entitled "Key Wearable Device Technologies Parameters for Innovative Healthcare Delivery in B5G Network: A Review" which you submitted to IEEE Access.

Please note that IEEE Access has a binary peer review process. Therefore, in order to uphold quality to IEEE standards, an article is rejected even if it requires minor edits.

Your manuscript has not been recommended for publication in IEEE Access in its current form; however, we do encourage you to address the concerns and criticisms of the reviewers detailed at the bottom of this letter and resubmit your article once you have updated it accordingly.

Please revise your manuscript based on reviewers’ feedback and resubmit; elaborate on your points and clarify with references, examples, data, etc. If you do not agree with the reviewers’ views, then include your arguments in the updated manuscript. Also, note that if a reviewer suggested references, you should only add ones that will make your article better and more complete. Recommending references to specific publications is not appropriate for reviewers and you should report excessive cases to ieeeaccessEIC@ieee.org.

Please be advised that authors are only permitted to resubmit their article ONCE. If the updated manuscript is determined not to have addressed all of the previous reviewers’ concerns, the article may be rejected and no further resubmissions will be allowed.

When resubmitting, please submit as a new manuscript via our submission site, the IEEE Author Portal, and include the following 3 files:

1) A document containing your response to reviewers from the previous peer review.  The “response to reviewers” document (template attached) should have the following regarding each comment: a) Reviewer’s concern, b) your response to the concern, c) your action to remedy the concern. The document should be uploaded with your manuscript files as a “Supplementary Material for Review.”

2) Your updated manuscript with all your individual changes highlighted, including grammatical changes (e.g. preferably with the yellow highlight tool within the pdf file). This file should be uploaded with your manuscript files as a “Supplementary Material for Review.”
